name_location: Chipotle Mexican Grill · Marylebone, England, United Kingdom Reposted  2 days ago  · 358 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Culinary Lead, Chipotle International (23028797)

Description

CULTIVATE A BETTER WORLD

Food served fast does not have to be a typical fast-food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We are changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you will join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As the Chipotle Culinary Lead for Chipotle International you will oversee Chipotle Culinary and its alignment with our Global Brand Standards which includes oversight of the Chipotle equity owned and operated markets in Europe and our other global partnerships. You will partner with our international Chipotle team, strategic regional suppliers, regional operations team, and our USA based leadership team to deliver a consistent Chipotle experience globally.

This is a leadership role involving the fluency in culinary skills, Chipotle's culinary execution, and Chipotle's Food with Integrity (FWI) ethos. The ability to partner strategically with suppliers to match our commercialized products and understanding large scale production is vital. An understanding of Food Safety, Quality Assurance, and Commercialization protocols is essential.

You will partner with the regional culinary operations teams to ensure restaurant culinary recipes and standards in local markets are maintained and meet the aligned-on Global Brand Standard. You will also lead any regional culinary and menu work required to support local menu adjustments by leveraging a combination of local market and consumer insights.

Developing and implementing processes and protocols to drive consistency in our proprietary products, food quality, and in restaurant execution will be essential.

This role reports directly into the Vice President for Chipotle Culinary and will partner with the leadership team in Europe and our licensed partners to ensure we are championing Chipotle's Food with Integrity mission across the globe.

What You'll Do

 Maintain Global Culinary Standards: Develop and execute a comprehensive Global Culinary Standards strategy aligned with Chipotle's objectives of delivering a consistent culinary experience. This will account for strategic suppliers, regional operations, marketing, food safety, and quality assurance stakeholders. The strategy will include a comprehensive process to calibrate on the Chipotle Core menu standards in addition to the review, approval, and organization of regional menu adjustments to support local and regional preferences, cultural nuances, and legislation.
 Strategic Supplier Partnerships: You will partner closely with the international supply chain team and strategic suppliers to ensure core menu ingredients meets our global culinary FWI standards. This includes liaising with the US teams and suppliers to understand the core ingredients.
 Restaurant Operations Support: Partner with the Operations Services team to drive culinary capability and brand standards internationally. This means leveraging the stage-gate process to support the ops services efforts impacting culinary.
 Teach & Taste Chipotle: As the Director of Culinary International, you will be an expert in Chipotle's FWI mission and our Real food proposition. Our value of Teaching and Tasting is critical and is supported with restaurant visits, food demonstrations, delivering strategic feedback, and providing support to enhance the FWI ethos, skills, knowledge, and performance of restaurant culinary to regional teams.
 Kitchen Innovation and Procurement: Partners with the global business on culinary process and equipment innovation initiatives to bring efficiency to international markets. Oversight of kitchen equipment and technology procurement to support consistency and drive cost efficiencies.
 Cross-functional Collaboration: Operationalise culinary innovation and change via effective collaboration with operations, FSQA, brand marketing, training, finance and procurement to align culinary initiatives with overall business objectives and ensure seamless integration of culinary strategies.
 Consumer Testing and Validation: Partner with the regional marketing and consumer insights team to develop and implement a consumer testing protocol for Core menu ingredients and recipe adjustments
 Budgeting and Cost Control: Manage culinary budgets, monitor costs, and identify opportunities for cost-saving initiatives without compromising quality or guest experience.


What You'll Bring To The Table

 A Passion for people, hospitality, and Real Food with Integrity
 Culinary Arts Degree/Certification
 Bachelor's or Master's degree preferred
 Language skills (English + 1-2 European languages) preferred
 A minimum of 10 years of progressive culinary experience, including international exposure and leadership roles
 Experience in multi-unit operations in regional European markets preferred
 Experienced and knowledge in large scale commercialization and production environments
 Strong understanding of food science, food safety, and quality assurance standards
 Strong understanding of international food regulations, health and safety standards, and food handling practices
 Proven track record in menu development, culinary innovation, and successful implementation of culinary strategies across multi-location operations
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster collaboration and build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Highly articulate and able to present to diverse audiences including leadership with proficiency in food tastings, PowerPoint and other impactful presentation formats
 Strong business acumen, with experience in budgeting, cost control, and financial analysis


Who We Are

Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has over 3,000 restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants. Chipotle is ranked on the Fortune 500 and is recognized on the 2022 list for Fortune's Most Admired Companies. With over 100,000 employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visit www.chipotle.com

name_location: BAE Systems · Samlesbury, England, United Kingdom  3 weeks ago  · 89 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Structural Engineer

Location Dhahran

JOB PURPOSE
The Chief Tornado Aircraft Structural Engineer is a Structural specialist, with skills and knowledge beyond those expected of maintenance personnel and who is responsible for advising the RSAF on all stressing matters for aircraft structural repairs and other aircraft structural design work relating to Tornado and also all other aircraft operated in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia eg Hawk, PC-21 etc). They will also provide training appropriate to the needs of RSAF Engineers in the Aeronautical Engineering Squadron. 

JOB ACCOUNTABILTIES
Ensure that methods and data used for repairs completed in Kingdom are compatible with those necessary to maintain the structural integrity of the aircraft and respect the standard procedures of the Design Authority.
Identify those aircraft repairs that need referral to the Design Authority and cannot be dealt with in-Kingdom and ensure liaison between the Design Authority and RSAF Aeronautical Engineering staff in progressing repair work.
Undertake initially all damage assessments on behalf of the RSAF in order to establish the extent of repair action required.
Provide advice and assistance during the embodiment of aircraft and A.G.E. structural modifications.
Provide structural engineering assistance to aircraft Incident and Accident investigations.
Investigate and make recommendations on inspection schedules / maintenance requirements etc. for recurring structural problems
Prepare and draft briefs for the RSAF to be presented to MODSAP, the Prime Contractor and vendors at formal and informal meetings such as the Tornado Support Review, the SBDCP Structures Review and the Tornado Aircraft Meeting
Classroom situation including the preparation and delivery of instruction that will ultimately lead to the award of a certificate of completion for the AES Engineers involved.

RECRUITMENT SPECIFICATION 
Qualifications:
Honours Degree or equivalent in Structure related discipline (Aeronautical, Mechanical, Civil etc.) is essential.
To have completed a recognized course in aircraft engineering or related engineering discipline at a military or civilian school of technical training, and/or have completed an appropriate apprenticeship would be desirable.

Relevant Experience:
Extensive proven experience as an aircraft Stress Engineer with proven extensive experience spent on Tornado, and proven experience spent in fatigue stress analysis.
Design Authority signatory for Tornado aircraft.
Self-motivated with the ability to analyse problems and formulate solutions to new issues that are outside the scope of the T.O.’s., but which respect the design philosophy of the aircraft type.
Ability to be able to produce high quality letters and reports using the Microsoft Office suite of programmes.
Ability to be able to produce high quality drawings and repair instructions for technicians to follow in the repair of aircraft and A.G.E. using the AutoCAD drawing package.

RECRUITMENT
Ideally, candidates suitable for consideration for this position will have been employed within the Structures Department of BAE Systems. This is essential if the applicant is to be considered suitable to be granted Design Authority Signatory approval for SBDCP aircraft types.

EXPATRIATE EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
In return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation, with access to free recreation facilities, all available within Company secured accommodation. In addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. 
On successfully securing a role your appointment to Saudi Arabia will initially be on single status. On commencement of employment in Saudi Arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. A full health care scheme is provided within Saudi Arabia.
SAUDI NATIONAL EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
In return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary and benefits package, including a generous leave and travel allowance, a full health care scheme and access to subsidised recreational facilities

BAE Systems
At BAE Systems, we serve the needs of our customers by delivering a wide range of advanced defence, aerospace, and security solutions that provide a technological and performance edge. We work together with local partners to develop, engineer, manufacture and support the innovations that sustain economies, increase defence sovereignty and safeguard commercial interests. With some 88,000 employees in six continents, our story is about talented people who are relentlessly committed to creating solutions that protect and strengthen nations, commerce, communities, and people. That’s work that inspires us. That’s BAE Systems.
All appointments in Saudi Arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary Government and/or Customer approvals.

name_location: Oxford Instruments plc · DACH  4 days ago  · 47 applicants
job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a Territory Sales Manager, an experienced sales professional to be based in Germany, Finland, Luxembourg, Sweden or Switzerland (home based with easy access to an airport) and represent us in the DACH and North Europe region, building strong networks, capitalising on sales leads, and developing our presence within the industry.

The opportunity

In this role you will report to the EMEA Sales Manager and be responsible for achieving the defined sales targets for your territory, whilst maximising profitability. You will be required to identify and act on new business opportunities, ensure that high quality tenders are submitted, as well as building and maintaining relationships with customers and developing knowledge of their applications and research networks. Working with the OI Marketing team you will actively promote our products in your territory, increasing our market presence, whilst continually gathering intelligence on our products, the market and our competitors to ensure that we are positioned as the preferred partner at all times.

About You

As a dynamic, self-motivated individual with excellent communication skills, you will be happy to work independently, have the ability to build strong relationships with new and existing customers and be able to understand our products, the market and how we can best meet the needs of our customers for their current and future endeavours.

You are likely to have a degree in a relevant technical subject, however it is more important that you have proven experience working as a successful sales professional in a high-tech industry. Previous experience of selling high value capital equipment to academic and government institutions is essential. You are fluent in German and English. It would be desirable if you have prior knowledge of Miller Heiman Sales Training, however training will be provided.

Benefits
 In addition to a competitive starting salary, Oxford Instruments offers flexible working hours and a half-day on Fridays. We also offer 25 days annual leave, private healthcare, a share incentive plan, a defined contribution Group Personal Pension Plan, and a flexible benefits package that you can tailor to your own requirements. We also invest in our talented employees by supporting them in their ongoing career and development so that they reach their full potential. We care and work hard to provide a workplace where you can grow and learn.

job_description:
About the job
We are ProAmpac, a leading global flexible packaging company with a comprehensive product offering. ProAmpac provides creative packaging solutions, industry-leading service and award-winning innovation to a diverse global marketplace. If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding career in Manufacturing, you might be the perfect fit for our Shift Leader position, based in Lincoln.
This position is based at ProAmpac Lincoln Ltd, Horncastle Lane, Lincoln. The rate of pay is £18.55 per hour and 42 hours per week (annual remuneration circa. £40,523 + OT opportunities). The shift pattern is 4on,4off. The role is a permanent role. We offer a contributory pension scheme and a range of benefits including a site bonus scheme and employee assistance programme.
As a Shift Leader, you will be responsible for coordinating and assisting with the activities of team members, ensuring compliance with all safety, operational and employment policies and practices. You will also be accountable for quality, production, documentation, reports, good manufacturing practices and cleaning procedures over your whole shift. You will seek out opportunities to improve established manufacturing practices and become the first point of contact for employee concerns. You will also support management activities, train and mentor employees, understand machine requirements and departmental costs, and work with other department leaders on continual improvement and best practices within the organization. You will have the ability to identify and allocate workload appropriately according to employee strengths and skillsets.
To be successful in this role, you should have the following qualifications and experience:
• Experience of leading or managing a team to achieve results.• Excellent interpersonal skills and people management experience.• Extensive manufacturing experience preferable within the flexographic print industry.• Completion of IOSH training preferable but training would be given.• Ability to manage moderately complex issues and problems.• Solid working knowledge of flexographic printing press processes and related manufacturing.• Experience using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point) and Outlook.• Maintains strict confidentiality and protects privacy of confidential/sensitive information.• Exceptional time management and organization skills.• Ability to communicate effectively (verbal, written, and presentations).• Proactive; exercises sound judgment and decision making; able to identify problems and needs to develop solutions and/or options.• Self-confident, self-motivated polished professional who thrives in a challenging, fast-paced environment.• Proven track record of performing with minimal supervision.
As a Shift Leader at ProAmpac Lincoln, you will also embody and promote the company values (5Is): Integrity, Intensity, Innovation, Involvement and Impact. 
Interested in this role as the next step in your career? If so, please apply directly through this advertisement.

name_location: Invicro · London, England, United Kingdom Reposted  3 days ago  · 158 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Invicro is the world’s leading translational imaging company, based in London (UK), Boston and New Haven (USA). Invicro specialises in molecular and functional imaging studies to support medical and pharmaceutical research. The London site where this role is based, operates a unique clinical and pre-clinical imaging centre with state-of-the-art PET and MRI technology used to support clinical research.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in PET modelling and analysis and to be a part of a PET/MRI Analysis Team responsible for the development of analysis methods and their application to clinical imaging studies.

The Role 

The individual will develop and apply modelling and analysis techniques to Invicro imaging studies to provide quantitative decision making data to commercial and academic clients. This will include taking a lead role in the experimental design of imaging studies, the application of established and novel image analysis methods as appropriate, interpretation and reporting of results. The successful candidate will be expected to maintain a profile in the PET imaging field, through scientific publications and attendance of international conferences.

The Candidate

We are seeking a candidate who can demonstrate a strong expertise in quantitative analysis with a deep understanding of bio-mathematics and their application to imaging studies.

The successful candidate must be proficient in scientific programming, using scripting languages and processing environments such as MATLAB and FSL for image data processing and analysis.

We will consider candidates with a range of levels of experience, but candidates are expected to have a PhD in a relevant field and are able to demonstrate that they proactively keep up to date with new developments in PET analysis. The successful candidate must have a ‘can do’ attitude, excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong analytical skills, a logical approach to problem solving and excellent attention to detail.

Competitive Salary & Benefits

Position grade level will be determined based on the experience of the candidate.

Contributory Pension, Bonus, Private Medical Insurance, Life Assurance & Flexible Benefits options.

We ensure compliance with Data Protection laws and you can find our Privacy Notice at https://invicro.com/privacy-policy/

Invicro is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

name_location: ICON Strategic Solutions · EMEA Reposted  1 week ago  · 289 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Position Summary
TA BP acts as an intermediary for clients and candidates. Consults with internal stakeholders and clients about execution of operational and specialist positions. Realise the successful fulfilment of the staffing needs for the dedicated assignments in own discipline/industry segmentation from the client and candidate perspective according to job order and internal guidelines and procedures in order to achieve the formulated targets. Able to build good relationships with candidates and stakeholders. Makes use of existing network. Knows where to find candidates, utilizing all available sources and tools – internally and externally.

Works under close supervision of a Recruitment Manager/Business Director and within internal guidelines. Guides candidates and clients under supervision regarding offers. Draws up and executes project plan under close supervision.

Job Functions / Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the TA BP include, but are not limited to:
ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Take a full and comprehensive job order according to the internal checklist/procedures to ensure a full and complete understanding of a client’s staffing need, its context and the difficulty/feasibility of the assignment.
Establish a project plan and set timelines for the dedicated assignment, in line with client requirements and in consultation with the direct / functional manager, in such a way that project steps and accountabilities are clear and expectations regarding the project can be communicated and fine-tuned with the client.
Identify, search and select candidates, by searching the databases, gathering names from own network or by headhunting candidates and assess candidates by interviewing, in line with characteristics as defined in the Job order, in order to be able to make the best match between the candidate, the job, the staffing need and the client organization.
Introduce the candidates to the client organization, arrange interviews, keep candidates and clients up-to-date about the process and outcomes, as well as counsel and coach the client organization and the candidates during this process, in order to be optimally informed about the process and to be able to ensure a positive outcome.
Coordinate the process of offering and negotiating between the selected candidate and client organization, as well as coach the candidate through the resignation process, in line with legal requirements, aimed at securing the placement.
Coordinate the formulation of the (standard) CP contracts by Human Resources, as well as coordinate the signing of the contracts by client, (candidate) and (European) Business Director, in line with internal guidelines and legal requirements, to ensure that contracts are established within the best possible terms and signed by the relevant parties.
Give guidance to the candidate and client organization before and during the (contract) placement, evaluate the services provided by DOCS and keep in contact with candidate and client, in order to contribute to the satisfaction of and successful cooperation between client and candidate.
Document all relevant market, client, candidate and contract data in the database, in accordance with internal guidelines and legal requirements, in such way that relevant information is correct and available at all times.
Develop and maintain a network of candidates, as well as excellent relationships with dedicated clients, in collaboration with the direct / functional manager, in order to expand and maintain the database and support acquisition of new candidates, clients and assignments. 
COMPLEXITY OF JOB
Working methods and processes are defined and followed strictly.
Reports on defaults in progress.
Handles basic TA questions.
Ensures full compliance with systems and data requirements
Deals mostly with regular assignments with local clients or across EMEA
Search process is mainly focused on operational recurring positions and mostly based on database and network search, external networking search. 
BUSINESS IMPACT
Impact: Realizes the turnover target on designated assignments and targets.
Scope: Number of placements/revenue target

 KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS
Number of placements
Margin
Success rate (hit rate) %
Efficiency of execution of processes & ensuring aged roles are below 25%
Accuracy of administration/database, systems and processes
Client and internal stakeholders satisfaction
Candidate satisfaction

COMPETENCIES
Commercial - Client focus and understanding - Advanced
Interpersonal - Communication – at all levels of stakeholders
Interpersonal - Relationship building - Advanced
Managerial - Planning & Organizing own schedule
Managerial - Result orientation – Prioritizing and self management
Professional - Accuracy – Procedural & systems
Professional - Initiative - Effective

Skills And Experience
Basic know-how of instruments and methods within own service (CP/PP).
Existing experience within recruitment/CRO or industry expertise
Commercial awareness
Higher Vocational working and thinking level
Must visit the office 3 days a week
Fluent in German language written and spoken is a must

job_description:
About the job
Global Head of Cyber Security

A leading global professional services consultancy is seeking a visionary and seasoned professional to assume the Global Head of Cyber Security role. With a strong commitment to innovation, they are looking for an individual who can redefine and strengthen its global cyber security offering. If you are a thought leader in cyber security, possess unparalleled industry expertise, and have the gravitas to influence and lead in a dynamic global environment, we want to hear from you.

Role Description:

As the Global Head of Cyber Security, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and reinventing the organisation's cyber security strategies and solutions to address the evolving threat landscape. This role demands a visionary leader who deeply understands current cybersecurity trends and their market impact. You will be entrusted with the following responsibilities:

Responsibilities
Cyber Security Visionary: Define a forward-thinking cyber security strategy that aligns with the company's global business objectives.
Thought Leadership: Act as the organisation's primary thought leader in cyber security, staying abreast of emerging trends and technologies.
Global Cyber Security Portfolio: Oversee the development, enhancement, and delivery of a comprehensive suite of cyber security services and solutions on a global scale.
Strategic Partnerships: Forge strategic partnerships with industry leaders, technology providers, and other stakeholders to enhance the organization's cyber security capabilities.
Market Analysis: Continuously assess the market dynamics, competition, and regulatory landscape to identify opportunities and threats.
Team Leadership: manage, influence, and motivate in-country leaders.
Client Engagement: Collaborate closely at C-Level with clients to understand their unique cyber security challenges and provide tailored solutions that drive value.

Qualifications:
Proven track record of senior leadership in global cyber security roles within professional services or related industries.
Exceptional understanding of current cyber security trends, threats, and market dynamics.
Strong thought leadership and public speaking abilities, with a demonstrated ability to influence industry discourse.
Adept at building and nurturing relationships with key stakeholders, including clients and partners.
Entrepreneurial mindset with a track record of driving innovation and growth.
Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong organisational and project management abilities.
Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CISA are a plus.

This role reports directly into the Vice President for Chipotle Culinary and will partner with the leadership team in Europe and our licensed partners to ensure we are championing Chipotle's Food with Integrity mission across the globe.

What You'll Do

 Maintain Global Culinary Standards: Develop and execute a comprehensive Global Culinary Standards strategy aligned with Chipotle's objectives of delivering a consistent culinary experience. This will account for strategic suppliers, regional operations, marketing, food safety, and quality assurance stakeholders. The strategy will include a comprehensive process to calibrate on the Chipotle Core menu standards in addition to the review, approval, and organization of regional menu adjustments to support local and regional preferences, cultural nuances, and legislation.
 Strategic Supplier Partnerships: You will partner closely with the international supply chain team and strategic suppliers to ensure core menu ingredients meets our global culinary FWI standards. This includes liaising with the US teams and suppliers to understand the core ingredients.
 Restaurant Operations Support: Partner with the Operations Services team to drive culinary capability and brand standards internationally. This means leveraging the stage-gate process to support the ops services efforts impacting culinary.
 Teach & Taste Chipotle: As the Director of Culinary International, you will be an expert in Chipotle's FWI mission and our Real food proposition. Our value of Teaching and Tasting is critical and is supported with restaurant visits, food demonstrations, delivering strategic feedback, and providing support to enhance the FWI ethos, skills, knowledge, and performance of restaurant culinary to regional teams.
 Kitchen Innovation and Procurement: Partners with the global business on culinary process and equipment innovation initiatives to bring efficiency to international markets. Oversight of kitchen equipment and technology procurement to support consistency and drive cost efficiencies.
 Cross-functional Collaboration: Operationalise culinary innovation and change via effective collaboration with operations, FSQA, brand marketing, training, finance and procurement to align culinary initiatives with overall business objectives and ensure seamless integration of culinary strategies.
 Consumer Testing and Validation: Partner with the regional marketing and consumer insights team to develop and implement a consumer testing protocol for Core menu ingredients and recipe adjustments
 Budgeting and Cost Control: Manage culinary budgets, monitor costs, and identify opportunities for cost-saving initiatives without compromising quality or guest experience.


What You'll Bring To The Table

 A Passion for people, hospitality, and Real Food with Integrity
 Culinary Arts Degree/Certification
 Bachelor's or Master's degree preferred
 Language skills (English + 1-2 European languages) preferred
 A minimum of 10 years of progressive culinary experience, including international exposure and leadership roles
 Experience in multi-unit operations in regional European markets preferred
 Experienced and knowledge in large scale commercialization and production environments
 Strong understanding of food science, food safety, and quality assurance standards
 Strong understanding of international food regulations, health and safety standards, and food handling practices
 Proven track record in menu development, culinary innovation, and successful implementation of culinary strategies across multi-location operations
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster collaboration and build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Highly articulate and able to present to diverse audiences including leadership with proficiency in food tastings, PowerPoint and other impactful presentation formats
 Strong business acumen, with experience in budgeting, cost control, and financial analysis


Who We Are

Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has over 3,000 restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants. Chipotle is ranked on the Fortune 500 and is recognized on the 2022 list for Fortune's Most Admired Companies. With over 100,000 employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visit www.chipotle.com

name_location: BAE Systems · Samlesbury, England, United Kingdom  3 weeks ago  · 89 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Structural Engineer

Location Dhahran

JOB PURPOSE
The Chief Tornado Aircraft Structural Engineer is a Structural specialist, with skills and knowledge beyond those expected of maintenance personnel and who is responsible for advising the RSAF on all stressing matters for aircraft structural repairs and other aircraft structural design work relating to Tornado and also all other aircraft operated in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia eg Hawk, PC-21 etc). They will also provide training appropriate to the needs of RSAF Engineers in the Aeronautical Engineering Squadron. 

JOB ACCOUNTABILTIES
Ensure that methods and data used for repairs completed in Kingdom are compatible with those necessary to maintain the structural integrity of the aircraft and respect the standard procedures of the Design Authority.
Identify those aircraft repairs that need referral to the Design Authority and cannot be dealt with in-Kingdom and ensure liaison between the Design Authority and RSAF Aeronautical Engineering staff in progressing repair work.
Undertake initially all damage assessments on behalf of the RSAF in order to establish the extent of repair action required.
Provide advice and assistance during the embodiment of aircraft and A.G.E. structural modifications.
Provide structural engineering assistance to aircraft Incident and Accident investigations.
Investigate and make recommendations on inspection schedules / maintenance requirements etc. for recurring structural problems
Prepare and draft briefs for the RSAF to be presented to MODSAP, the Prime Contractor and vendors at formal and informal meetings such as the Tornado Support Review, the SBDCP Structures Review and the Tornado Aircraft Meeting
Classroom situation including the preparation and delivery of instruction that will ultimately lead to the award of a certificate of completion for the AES Engineers involved.

RECRUITMENT SPECIFICATION 
Qualifications:
Honours Degree or equivalent in Structure related discipline (Aeronautical, Mechanical, Civil etc.) is essential.
To have completed a recognized course in aircraft engineering or related engineering discipline at a military or civilian school of technical training, and/or have completed an appropriate apprenticeship would be desirable.

Relevant Experience:
Extensive proven experience as an aircraft Stress Engineer with proven extensive experience spent on Tornado, and proven experience spent in fatigue stress analysis.
Design Authority signatory for Tornado aircraft.
Self-motivated with the ability to analyse problems and formulate solutions to new issues that are outside the scope of the T.O.’s., but which respect the design philosophy of the aircraft type.
Ability to be able to produce high quality letters and reports using the Microsoft Office suite of programmes.
Ability to be able to produce high quality drawings and repair instructions for technicians to follow in the repair of aircraft and A.G.E. using the AutoCAD drawing package.

RECRUITMENT
Ideally, candidates suitable for consideration for this position will have been employed within the Structures Department of BAE Systems. This is essential if the applicant is to be considered suitable to be granted Design Authority Signatory approval for SBDCP aircraft types.

EXPATRIATE EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
In return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation, with access to free recreation facilities, all available within Company secured accommodation. In addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. 
On successfully securing a role your appointment to Saudi Arabia will initially be on single status. On commencement of employment in Saudi Arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. A full health care scheme is provided within Saudi Arabia.
SAUDI NATIONAL EMPLOYEE BENEFITS
In return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary and benefits package, including a generous leave and travel allowance, a full health care scheme and access to subsidised recreational facilities

BAE Systems
At BAE Systems, we serve the needs of our customers by delivering a wide range of advanced defence, aerospace, and security solutions that provide a technological and performance edge. We work together with local partners to develop, engineer, manufacture and support the innovations that sustain economies, increase defence sovereignty and safeguard commercial interests. With some 88,000 employees in six continents, our story is about talented people who are relentlessly committed to creating solutions that protect and strengthen nations, commerce, communities, and people. That’s work that inspires us. That’s BAE Systems.
All appointments in Saudi Arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary Government and/or Customer approvals.

job_description:
About the job
We are looking for a Territory Sales Manager, an experienced sales professional to be based in Germany, Finland, Luxembourg, Sweden or Switzerland (home based with easy access to an airport) and represent us in the DACH and North Europe region, building strong networks, capitalising on sales leads, and developing our presence within the industry.

The opportunity

In this role you will report to the EMEA Sales Manager and be responsible for achieving the defined sales targets for your territory, whilst maximising profitability. You will be required to identify and act on new business opportunities, ensure that high quality tenders are submitted, as well as building and maintaining relationships with customers and developing knowledge of their applications and research networks. Working with the OI Marketing team you will actively promote our products in your territory, increasing our market presence, whilst continually gathering intelligence on our products, the market and our competitors to ensure that we are positioned as the preferred partner at all times.

About You

As a dynamic, self-motivated individual with excellent communication skills, you will be happy to work independently, have the ability to build strong relationships with new and existing customers and be able to understand our products, the market and how we can best meet the needs of our customers for their current and future endeavours.

You are likely to have a degree in a relevant technical subject, however it is more important that you have proven experience working as a successful sales professional in a high-tech industry. Previous experience of selling high value capital equipment to academic and government institutions is essential. You are fluent in German and English. It would be desirable if you have prior knowledge of Miller Heiman Sales Training, however training will be provided.

Benefits
 In addition to a competitive starting salary, Oxford Instruments offers flexible working hours and a half-day on Fridays. We also offer 25 days annual leave, private healthcare, a share incentive plan, a defined contribution Group Personal Pension Plan, and a flexible benefits package that you can tailor to your own requirements. We also invest in our talented employees by supporting them in their ongoing career and development so that they reach their full potential. We care and work hard to provide a workplace where you can grow and learn.

job_description:
About the job
We are ProAmpac, a leading global flexible packaging company with a comprehensive product offering. ProAmpac provides creative packaging solutions, industry-leading service and award-winning innovation to a diverse global marketplace. If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding career in Manufacturing, you might be the perfect fit for our Shift Leader position, based in Lincoln.
This position is based at ProAmpac Lincoln Ltd, Horncastle Lane, Lincoln. The rate of pay is £18.55 per hour and 42 hours per week (annual remuneration circa. £40,523 + OT opportunities). The shift pattern is 4on,4off. The role is a permanent role. We offer a contributory pension scheme and a range of benefits including a site bonus scheme and employee assistance programme.
As a Shift Leader, you will be responsible for coordinating and assisting with the activities of team members, ensuring compliance with all safety, operational and employment policies and practices. You will also be accountable for quality, production, documentation, reports, good manufacturing practices and cleaning procedures over your whole shift. You will seek out opportunities to improve established manufacturing practices and become the first point of contact for employee concerns. You will also support management activities, train and mentor employees, understand machine requirements and departmental costs, and work with other department leaders on continual improvement and best practices within the organization. You will have the ability to identify and allocate workload appropriately according to employee strengths and skillsets.
To be successful in this role, you should have the following qualifications and experience:
• Experience of leading or managing a team to achieve results.• Excellent interpersonal skills and people management experience.• Extensive manufacturing experience preferable within the flexographic print industry.• Completion of IOSH training preferable but training would be given.• Ability to manage moderately complex issues and problems.• Solid working knowledge of flexographic printing press processes and related manufacturing.• Experience using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point) and Outlook.• Maintains strict confidentiality and protects privacy of confidential/sensitive information.• Exceptional time management and organization skills.• Ability to communicate effectively (verbal, written, and presentations).• Proactive; exercises sound judgment and decision making; able to identify problems and needs to develop solutions and/or options.• Self-confident, self-motivated polished professional who thrives in a challenging, fast-paced environment.• Proven track record of performing with minimal supervision.
As a Shift Leader at ProAmpac Lincoln, you will also embody and promote the company values (5Is): Integrity, Intensity, Innovation, Involvement and Impact. 
Interested in this role as the next step in your career? If so, please apply directly through this advertisement.

name_location: Invicro · London, England, United Kingdom Reposted  3 days ago  · 158 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Invicro is the world’s leading translational imaging company, based in London (UK), Boston and New Haven (USA). Invicro specialises in molecular and functional imaging studies to support medical and pharmaceutical research. The London site where this role is based, operates a unique clinical and pre-clinical imaging centre with state-of-the-art PET and MRI technology used to support clinical research.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in PET modelling and analysis and to be a part of a PET/MRI Analysis Team responsible for the development of analysis methods and their application to clinical imaging studies.

The Role 

The individual will develop and apply modelling and analysis techniques to Invicro imaging studies to provide quantitative decision making data to commercial and academic clients. This will include taking a lead role in the experimental design of imaging studies, the application of established and novel image analysis methods as appropriate, interpretation and reporting of results. The successful candidate will be expected to maintain a profile in the PET imaging field, through scientific publications and attendance of international conferences.

The Candidate

We are seeking a candidate who can demonstrate a strong expertise in quantitative analysis with a deep understanding of bio-mathematics and their application to imaging studies.

The successful candidate must be proficient in scientific programming, using scripting languages and processing environments such as MATLAB and FSL for image data processing and analysis.

We will consider candidates with a range of levels of experience, but candidates are expected to have a PhD in a relevant field and are able to demonstrate that they proactively keep up to date with new developments in PET analysis. The successful candidate must have a ‘can do’ attitude, excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong analytical skills, a logical approach to problem solving and excellent attention to detail.

Competitive Salary & Benefits

Position grade level will be determined based on the experience of the candidate.

Contributory Pension, Bonus, Private Medical Insurance, Life Assurance & Flexible Benefits options.

We ensure compliance with Data Protection laws and you can find our Privacy Notice at https://invicro.com/privacy-policy/

Invicro is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

name_location: Submarine Delivery Agency · Barrow-in-Furness, England, United Kingdom  3 weeks ago  · 279 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Salary 
£58,500 - £62,900 per annum (pro rata), plus generous benefits and an average employer pension contribution of 27%. 

Grade
Professional I

Working Pattern
Full time, part time, flexible working, job share

Contract
Permanent 

Job description 

Join the Submarine Delivery Agency (SDA) in this key specialist role as a Senior Qualified Accountant. This is a role offering significant scope, with responsibility across delivery, policy, strategic direction, and leadership.

The Submarine Production (SMP) team is responsible for managing the build and Sea Trials of Astute Class submarines prior to entry into service, working closely with suppliers and a wide stakeholder base.

You will strategically lead a team, encourage a culture of imaginative thinking, learning from experience and driving for improved quality by challenging the status quo. The role ensures that project costs are rigorously controlled, and relevant financial and performance reporting requirements are met through the provision of specialist financial services. The role enables Project Managers to deliver on scope, to time and to budget and make informed strategic decisions.

Your primary base is BAES Barrow-in-Furness, however we operate a hybrid working environment where there is an expectation to attend site at least once a week, however this may vary dependent on business needs.

The SDA is diverse in respect to gender, ethnicity, disability and age, ensuring we are a dynamic, innovative, problem solving and supportive team, arising from a diversity of thinking.

Please note, due to the security requirements required for this role, this post is reserved for Sole UK Nationals only.

Responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Lead an experienced and dynamic financial team ensuring appropriate delegation of work, support, and development opportunities

Oversee the monthly financial forecasting process for the Delivery Team, including financial risk, and accurate and insightful commentary, challenge and variance analysis. Lead on the Financial input and information at the Project Manager (PM) / Control Account Manager (CAM) monthly forecast reviews to empower stakeholder decision making

Oversee the Financial input to the Annual Budget Cycle process in conjunction with PM/Project Control Manager (PCM) and with the production of the Programme Cost Review (PCR) forecasts and the provision of Screening Packs

Work collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders in providing technical accounting guidance, advising of key risks and ensuring the accuracy and robustness of reporting. Lead the team in actively supporting audit and internal compliance. Advise on accounting and forecasting implications of policy and programme decisions. Liaise with Finance & Accounting (F&A) colleagues to ensure that VAT and FOREX treatment is correct

Provide key support to the business area to analyse, understand and report on financial performance against delivery schedules and targets, provide analysis of risks and opportunities, and working collaboratively provide prompt evaluation of proposals and Business Cases, returning feedback to the PM and Finance Business Partner

Oversee the Cost Control Finance team in working with Estimators to develop cost models and assist in the production of business proposals. Monitor project expenditure against approval

Lead the team in working with PM/Scheduler/PCM to implement Cost Loaded Schedules to drive forecasting. Guide the production of Earned Value Management (EVM) analysis to demonstrate project performance and analyse variances to plan, determine impact on the schedule and cost to complete the scope of work. Ensure consistency with IYM and EVM reporting

Advise on good financial management to contribute to good governance

Advocate and contribute to wider Finance Function responsibilities and activities whilst maintaining your CPD requirements

Person specification

To be successful with your application, you’ll need to show that you meet the following essential criteria:

Qualified accountant CCAB (including ICAEW, ACCA, CIPFA, ICAS, Chartered Accountants Ireland, CIMA or International equivalent), with full membership (Post Nominals i.e. with letters) of the relevant accounting body

Have significant post-qualified experience and knowledge in financial and management accounting techniques

Be able to demonstrate that you are an experienced leader, who can work on your own initiative and has had exposure to senior stakeholder

In addition to the responsibilities above, the following technical competences and behaviours will be assessed at interview:

Leading Financial Strategy

Financial Analysis, Management Information & Reporting

Communicating and influencing

Delivering at Pace


Benefits

25 days’ annual leave +1 day a year up to 30 days, 8 bank holidays and a day off for the King’s birthday
Flexible and hybrid working wherever possible, to support your work-life balance (though some attendance to the stated site is required)

Market-leading employer pension contribution of around 27%

Annual performance-based bonus and recognition awards

Access to specialist training and funded professional qualifications

Support for progression

Huge range of discounts

Volunteering days

Enhanced parental leave schemes

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where our people can grow, thrive, and be their authentic selves. We value diversity of thought and the ways in which it enriches our culture and our work. So whether you’re looking for a new opportunity, a next step, or a helping hand as you return from a career break, here you’ll find a supportive, family-friendly organisation to be a part of. And if you need any assistance with your application, just let us know.

Further Information

More information can be found below:

SDA benefits: https://bit.ly/3ne9QTm
Further Information: https://bit.ly/3K26Xhl
Terms and Conditions: https://bit.ly/3yUwcM1
Selection Process Details

Your application will go through the following stages of assessment:

1. Pre-sift – We will check that you meet any essential or eligibility criteria that are listed in the Person Specification section of this advert. On your CV, please clearly show how you meet the essential criteria.

2. Sift – Your CV will be assessed against the following categories, using a simple numerical scoring system: Key Achievements; Relevant Experience; Applied Knowledge and Skills

Please follow our guidance on CV writing for best chance of success.

3. Interview – If you’re invited to interview, you’ll be assessed against the Sift categories listed above, as well as the Technical Competences and Behaviours listed in the Person Specification section of this advert.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview.

Closing date - 23:55 on Sunday 1 October 2023

job_description:
About the job
Position Summary
TA BP acts as an intermediary for clients and candidates. Consults with internal stakeholders and clients about execution of operational and specialist positions. Realise the successful fulfilment of the staffing needs for the dedicated assignments in own discipline/industry segmentation from the client and candidate perspective according to job order and internal guidelines and procedures in order to achieve the formulated targets. Able to build good relationships with candidates and stakeholders. Makes use of existing network. Knows where to find candidates, utilizing all available sources and tools – internally and externally.

Works under close supervision of a Recruitment Manager/Business Director and within internal guidelines. Guides candidates and clients under supervision regarding offers. Draws up and executes project plan under close supervision.

Job Functions / Responsibilities

The responsibilities of the TA BP include, but are not limited to:
ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Take a full and comprehensive job order according to the internal checklist/procedures to ensure a full and complete understanding of a client’s staffing need, its context and the difficulty/feasibility of the assignment.
Establish a project plan and set timelines for the dedicated assignment, in line with client requirements and in consultation with the direct / functional manager, in such a way that project steps and accountabilities are clear and expectations regarding the project can be communicated and fine-tuned with the client.
Identify, search and select candidates, by searching the databases, gathering names from own network or by headhunting candidates and assess candidates by interviewing, in line with characteristics as defined in the Job order, in order to be able to make the best match between the candidate, the job, the staffing need and the client organization.
Introduce the candidates to the client organization, arrange interviews, keep candidates and clients up-to-date about the process and outcomes, as well as counsel and coach the client organization and the candidates during this process, in order to be optimally informed about the process and to be able to ensure a positive outcome.
Coordinate the process of offering and negotiating between the selected candidate and client organization, as well as coach the candidate through the resignation process, in line with legal requirements, aimed at securing the placement.
Coordinate the formulation of the (standard) CP contracts by Human Resources, as well as coordinate the signing of the contracts by client, (candidate) and (European) Business Director, in line with internal guidelines and legal requirements, to ensure that contracts are established within the best possible terms and signed by the relevant parties.
Give guidance to the candidate and client organization before and during the (contract) placement, evaluate the services provided by DOCS and keep in contact with candidate and client, in order to contribute to the satisfaction of and successful cooperation between client and candidate.
Document all relevant market, client, candidate and contract data in the database, in accordance with internal guidelines and legal requirements, in such way that relevant information is correct and available at all times.
Develop and maintain a network of candidates, as well as excellent relationships with dedicated clients, in collaboration with the direct / functional manager, in order to expand and maintain the database and support acquisition of new candidates, clients and assignments. 
COMPLEXITY OF JOB
Working methods and processes are defined and followed strictly.
Reports on defaults in progress.
Handles basic TA questions.
Ensures full compliance with systems and data requirements
Deals mostly with regular assignments with local clients or across EMEA
Search process is mainly focused on operational recurring positions and mostly based on database and network search, external networking search. 
BUSINESS IMPACT
Impact: Realizes the turnover target on designated assignments and targets.
Scope: Number of placements/revenue target

 KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS
Number of placements
Margin
Success rate (hit rate) %
Efficiency of execution of processes & ensuring aged roles are below 25%
Accuracy of administration/database, systems and processes
Client and internal stakeholders satisfaction
Candidate satisfaction

COMPETENCIES
Commercial - Client focus and understanding - Advanced
Interpersonal - Communication – at all levels of stakeholders
Interpersonal - Relationship building - Advanced
Managerial - Planning & Organizing own schedule
Managerial - Result orientation – Prioritizing and self management
Professional - Accuracy – Procedural & systems
Professional - Initiative - Effective

Skills And Experience
Basic know-how of instruments and methods within own service (CP/PP).
Existing experience within recruitment/CRO or industry expertise
Commercial awareness
Higher Vocational working and thinking level
Must visit the office 3 days a week
Fluent in German language written and spoken is a must

About the job
Global Head of Cyber Security

A leading global professional services consultancy is seeking a visionary and seasoned professional to assume the Global Head of Cyber Security role. With a strong commitment to innovation, they are looking for an individual who can redefine and strengthen its global cyber security offering. If you are a thought leader in cyber security, possess unparalleled industry expertise, and have the gravitas to influence and lead in a dynamic global environment, we want to hear from you.

Role Description:

As the Global Head of Cyber Security, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and reinventing the organisation's cyber security strategies and solutions to address the evolving threat landscape. This role demands a visionary leader who deeply understands current cybersecurity trends and their market impact. You will be entrusted with the following responsibilities:

Responsibilities
Cyber Security Visionary: Define a forward-thinking cyber security strategy that aligns with the company's global business objectives.
Thought Leadership: Act as the organisation's primary thought leader in cyber security, staying abreast of emerging trends and technologies.
Global Cyber Security Portfolio: Oversee the development, enhancement, and delivery of a comprehensive suite of cyber security services and solutions on a global scale.
Strategic Partnerships: Forge strategic partnerships with industry leaders, technology providers, and other stakeholders to enhance the organization's cyber security capabilities.
Market Analysis: Continuously assess the market dynamics, competition, and regulatory landscape to identify opportunities and threats.
Team Leadership: manage, influence, and motivate in-country leaders.
Client Engagement: Collaborate closely at C-Level with clients to understand their unique cyber security challenges and provide tailored solutions that drive value.

Qualifications:
Proven track record of senior leadership in global cyber security roles within professional services or related industries.
Exceptional understanding of current cyber security trends, threats, and market dynamics.
Strong thought leadership and public speaking abilities, with a demonstrated ability to influence industry discourse.
Adept at building and nurturing relationships with key stakeholders, including clients and partners.
Entrepreneurial mindset with a track record of driving innovation and growth.
Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong organisational and project management abilities.
Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CISA are a plus.

About the job
Led Program Manager focusing on Africa sought to join a scaling Series A business supporting on-the-ground nature-based carbon projects.

name_location: Midea UK (Midea Group - Fortune Global 500 Company) · Manchester, England, United Kingdom  2 weeks ago  · 538 applicants
job_description:
About the job
In order to effectively facilitate the supply chain operations in UK market, Midea UK, part of Midea Group, a Fortune Global 500 company are seeking an experienced Logistics Specialist to coordinate with excellent practise and processes to achieve the effective distribution.

Position: Logistics Specialist 
Direct Report: Supply Chain & Service Manager

Responsibilities include: 
1. Establish and maintain maximum and minimum inventory levels
Coordinate with in-house sales team to promote accurate and timely processing of orders for customers
2. Provide assistance for maintaining logistics planning tasks
3. Scan orders into computer and track shipments across multiple channels
4. Approve time sheets associated with deliveries and pick-ups
5. Administer and maintain inventory control program systems
6. Support with maintenance of logistics policies, procedures, support plans and similar data.
7. Manage and monitor the performance of entire fleet, routing and scheduling planning

Requirements for the role:
1. Bachelor's degree in Logistics or Business (preferred)
2. Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs
3. 1+ years previous experience in logistics management or coordination
4. Working knowledge of PC computer systems and cargo management software preferred
5. Great interpersonal skills
6. Excellent communication and time management skills
7. Well-developed motivational and team work skills
8. Excellent verbal and written communication skills


About Midea
Midea Group is the world’s largest manufacturer of consumer appliances and major appliances. It offers household and commercial air conditioning appliances, refrigeration, laundry, and large cooking appliances, kitchen appliances, water appliances, vacuum appliances, small domestic appliances, and lighting. 
Midea offer one of the widest-ranging product portfolios, from mass-market products to premium goods. Midea also carry a diverse range of brands under Midea Group’s umbrella, including globally recognized household names like Toshiba, Midea and Comfee.
Established in 1968, Midea (SZ:000333) is a publicly listed and ranked as a Forbes’ Global Fortune 500 company (#245). Midea offers one of the most comprehensive ranges in the home appliance industry. Midea is headquartered in Southern China, but is a truly global company with over 150,000 employees and operations in more than 195 countries, with 26 business units located around the world. 
The Midea UK office was opened in October 2020, the mission is to be a leading brand of consumer electronics in the UK over the next years, providing consumers with innovative, high-quality products at an affordable price.

More information about Midea Group:
2022 Revenue - $50 BN
Exports to over 200 countries and regions
150,000 employees globally
260 logistics centres worldwide

name_location: Synthesia · EMEA  5 days ago  · 313 applicants
job_description:
About the job
👋 TL;DR: we're looking for experienced engineers to join our team and work with a strong focus on SRE, Platform Engineering and our Developer Experience.

Who are we?

On a mission to make video easy for anyone …

Synthesia is the world’s #1 AI video generation platform. Well, it’s actually a video production studio — in a browser, no cameras or film crews at all. You choose an avatar, enter your script in one of 120 languages, and your video is ready in minutes.

In Synthesia, you can build persoalised on-the-fly videos, give your chatbot a human face or run 24/7 weather channels in different languages, to name just a few of the possibilities.

We believe the future of media is synthetic, and we are on a mission to turn cameras into code and make everyone a creator.

Not sure what we’re talking about? Check out our intro video that explains what we’re doing and t his video for an overview of the role from one of our avatars.

Who are we hiring?

We’re looking for a seasoned engineer with a strong SRE or Platform Engineering focus to join our team support our product engineering teams.

Today we’re a small team who all get stuck in, but we’re structuring our work so that as we scale people have a natural alignment to a future team structure.

What does that really mean? When you join you’ll focus on a type of work (SRE, Platform Engineering or Developer Experience) with an 80/20 split on your area and everything else. We’re written about this recently on LinkedIn.

We are looking for people who have been though the scale-up process before. We’re a Product organisation of 50, having more than doubled in the last year. During that time we’ve close to 10x’d our transaction rate. We expect to see similar growth over the next few years.

We’re not just a SaaS product running high-volume CRUD type transactions, we also have long-running, resource intensive AI workloads, both training and inference, at scale. We work closely with teams in Product Engineering, AI R&D, MLOps and Security.

Key Responsibilities

As a member of the team you will…

Work with engineering teams to design, evolve and run high-volume, customer facing systems, both new and existing, including those which aren’t sticking to our golden path supported by Platform Engineering.
Deliver projects which expand the capabilities of our shared platform. This includes everything from Source Code management and Service Patterns, through Build and Deploy, right though Container Orchestration and finishes with our Metrics and Alerting systems. We aim to provide a Golden Path for Engineers that makes them happy, productive and efficient.
Being a member of our on-call rota, which may include working out of hours. We have a one week rotation, swapping on a Tuesday, managed by PagerDuty, with the team lead being available for escalation at all times and in the on-call rota themselves.
You will not have any direct reports, but will play a part in development and support of your peers. Your role could evolve into a Team Lead if that is the way you want to take it in the future.


We are looking for somebody who:

Has been though the Scale Up phase of a business (300 to 1000 employees or equivalent), seeing product and company numbers increase significantly, and someone who played a important role in making that successful.
Can self-manage and deliver multiple projects as part of a quarterly planning cycle within a team.
Is an excellent communicator and can partner with engineers to solve both structural/systemic problems and those which are time critical (live operations).
Can work with clarity when under pressure during operational incidents
Enjoys helping others achieve their goals though collaboration; DevOps is a culture not a team name (but yes, it’s our team name right now).
Has extensive experience running and debugging customer facing Production systems, in a SaaS environment, at scale.
Has extensive experience working with containers, orchestrators and autoscaling/self-healing/low operations systems.


We use a wide range of technologies, and we can’t all be experts in all of them, so if you don’t hit every box on this list, we’d still encourage you to apply.

Our Current Stack Includes

AWS: We have a strong focus on ECS today, but also have the AWS serverless stack (APIGateway, Lambda, Fargate) in our world. We’re very interested in people with strong Kubernetes experience (EKS).
Services built in Python and NodeJS.
TerraGrunt and Terraform for infrastructure as code.
A lot of GPUs. We’re very interested in the people with the intersection of CloudNative+GPU+High workloads.
MongoDB Atlas. We’re very interested in people with strong Mongo experience.
Github Actions for build and deploy tooling..
Git for version control.


At Synthesia we expect everyone to:

Be an owner.
Focus on outcomes over inputs and plans.
Make the journey fun
Default to simple. 


You can read more about this in this public Notion page: https://synthesia.notion.site/How-we-work-at-Synthesia-f794caa72f8446efb6be22b551ce0fa2

You can expect in return...

💸 A competitive salary + stock options in our fast growing Series C start-up.

📍 A remote-friendly environment. We expect occasional travel (1x per quarter) for quarterly planning/retrospectives to one of our European hubs. You're welcome to work out of our offices in London, Copenhagen, Munich, or Amsterdam, too.

🏝 25 days of annual leave + public holidays in the country where you are based.

🥳 Regular socials and company retreats.

🤩 4 weeks paid sabbatical after 4 years at the company + $10,000 USD.

👉 A generous referral scheme.

💻 A brand new computer of your choice and the equipment you need to get your work done

🚀 A huge opportunity for career growth as you’ll help shape a market-defining product.

Other country-specific benefits based on the country you are hired in such as private healthcare & a pension.


Synthesia is fully committed to Equality, Diversity and Inclusion. Our ambition is to have an environment that is equitable, diverse and inclusive for all our employees now and in the future.We believe that everyone at Synthesia is equally important, that we should celebrate diversity and the value it brings, and that everyone should feel they belong. We want to be a business that champions equality and an inclusive culture; where there are no barriers to colleagues realising their potential; and where every individual feels valued, respected and accepted.

name_location: Sparta Global · London, England, United Kingdom  11 hours ago  · 17 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
About Sparta Global

We employ people from all backgrounds and give them careers within technology, working with enthusiastic individuals to give them the skills for success within the public and private sectors. We design careers, coach future leaders, and promote a more diverse and equal landscape with our work garnering over 10 awards across L&D and ED&I. We are a Top 20 Employer for Social Mobility and proud to say BCorp certified.

About This Role

Working as a Software Developer you will work closely with other developers, product managers, designers, business analysts and testers to constantly create, maintain and modify systems to meet the demands of the business and their stakeholders.

You will not only design and write well-formed, readable code but you'll be well-versed in standard practices such as Test-Driven Development and Behaviour-Driven Development and understand how you can work efficiently within agile continuous integration and continuous development (CI/CD) pipelines for your software delivery process.?

We're not expecting you to have the proficiencies right away - that's where our award-winning Academy comes in. We are the experts in building skills and confidence in a fun and supportive environment that will not only challenge you but also develop your specialist capabilities ready to work on our clients' projects.

What we're looking for

To be successful for this role you will demonstrate a level of ability in a choice of Java or C#. You will be passionate about technology and eager to learn programme development to an advanced level.

We also look for the following traits that align with companies' values:

Empathy and Diversity - You operate with integrity, respect everyone and set a good example?for the team.?

Drive - You challenge yourself to exceed targets to take pride in your work.

Collaboration - You work in synergy with others, supportive, approachable, build healthy relationships.

Innovation - Your inquisitiveness knows no bounds and you love to learn. You embrace creativity and enjoy working with different people and their viewpoints.?

Flexibility - Adaptable to change, you are calm and compassionate when responding to the unexpected.

Why should you apply????

We see ourselves as a people-powered business that likes to recognise and reward the hard work of our employees. We promote continuous learning and development with increasing earning potential for everyone who joins us.?By the end of your first year, based on our performance metrics, you can expect to earn an average of £29,000.

We Also Provide

20 days annual leave + bank holidays.
An extra day off for your birthday.
Pension.
Discounted gym membership.
Eye care.
Death in service cover.
Cycle to work scheme.
Season ticket loan.
Bonuses and structured pay rises.
Employee assistance program.
Yearly budget for personal development.
Access to alumni and community networks.
Opportunities to be brand ambassadors.

Being employed by Sparta Global is an investment in your future that pays dividends along the way. We give you breadth of experience and skills, along with increasing opportunities to develop further and earn more. No two career paths look the same at Sparta.

Minimum Requirements?????

We are a national organisation serving clients across the country. After completing remote training, you may be deployed to various client sites throughout the UK. Flexibility and willingness to relocate are essential as specific locations cannot be guaranteed. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and experience levels, but the successful candidate must, by the start of employment, have permission to work in the UK.

Our Recruitment Process

Online Application: Interested candidates can apply online through our application portal. Our talent team will review applications and contact qualified candidates within 48 hours for further recruitment steps.

Telephone Interview: Candidates who pass the initial screening will be invited to a telephone interview. We will assess communication skills, motivation, professionalism, and delve deeper into goals, interests, and background.

Online Assessments: Successful candidates from the telephone interview will complete online assessments evaluating technical competence in programming and cognitive abilities.

Competency Interview: Candidates excelling in the assessments will be invited to a competency interview. This interview provides an opportunity to showcase clear communication of technical concepts and behavioural competencies with relevant examples. We value candidates who demonstrate personality, collaborative skills, and a growth mindset.

How to Best Prepare for the Interview

Research the STAR Method (Situation, Task, Action, Result) and our six behavioural competencies. This knowledge will enable you to answer competency-based questions effectively. You can find a handy guide on answering competency questions on our website.

Visit our YouTube Channel: Gain valuable insights and expert advice on virtual interviews,, strategies to manage nerves, and tips on nonverbal communication.

We look forward to receiving your application - good luck!

job_description:
About the job
We are in search of diligent, detail-oriented individuals to join our team as Remote Entry-Level Data Entry Clerks. If you have a passion for precision and thrive in independent work environments, this opportunity might be your ideal fit. Come join us in contributing to a dynamic, expanding organization where your skills will have a tangible impact.

 ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY DIRECT ON OUR WEBSITE ** 

PLEASE CLICK HERE TO APPLY OR VISIT www.dataentrydigital.com

Responsibilities

Precisely input data into our systems from various sources.
Scrutinize and validate data for inconsistencies or errors.
Uphold data integrity and confidentiality at all times.
Organize and prioritize data entry tasks to meet deadlines.
Collaborate with team members to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Conduct quality checks on completed work.
Assist in developing and implementing data entry processes.
Address data entry issues as they arise.
Generate necessary reports and summaries.
Maintain databases with up-to-date information.
Participate in training programs to enhance data entry skills.
Adhere to company policies and procedures for data management.
Provide support to other departments with data-related tasks.
Maintain a high level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Adapt to new data entry technologies and tools.
 ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY DIRECT ON OUR WEBSITE ** 

PLEASE CLICK HERE TO APPLY OR VISIT www.dataentrydigital.com

Qualifications

High school diploma or equivalent.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and strong computer skills.
Excellent typing speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently and remotely.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Basic knowledge of data entry best practices.
Problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new processes.
Reliable internet connection and a suitable remote work environment.

Benefits

Competitive entry-level salary.
Flexible remote work schedule.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.
Ongoing training and development programs.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Access to cutting-edge data entry tools and technology.
Health, dental, and vision insurance options.
Generous paid time off and holidays.
Employee recognition and appreciation programs.
Work-life balance and remote work options.
Employee assistance program for personal and professional support.

If you're eager to kickstart an exciting career in data entry from the comfort of your own home, don't hesitate to apply today and become a valuable member of our dedicated team. We embrace diversity and inclusion, welcoming candidates from all backgrounds to join us in fulfilling our mission. Seize this opportunity to launch your data entry career with us!

 ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY DIRECT ON OUR WEBSITE ** 

PLEASE CLICK HERE TO APPLY OR VISIT www.dataentrydigital.com
