job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
About The Role

Are you looking for a fun and fast paced environment to work in, with great benefits?

Could you help us create lasting memories for our customers by providing outstanding customer service?

If so, then look no further!

The Why...

Join Hollywood Bowl Group as a Team Member, in return you'll get:

the opportunity to earn an extra 50p per hour, paid to you every month
access to apprenticeship programmes and our in-house management training programmes
optional pension plan
additional days holiday with length of service up to five days
ongoing training and development, with the opportunity to fast track your career
free game vouchers every month
30% discount off food and drink for you and up to five friends
50% off food when you are working
access to our Employee Assistant Programme for you and your family
financial long service awards
a £15 donation to Barnardo's when you complete your induction
enhanced maternity, paternity, adoption, and shared parental leave benefits
opportunity to join our healthcare cash plan

The What...

As a Team Member for Hollywood Bowl Group, you will be at the very centre of the customer's journey!

No two shifts are the same, you may be welcoming customers at reception, hosting parties on the lanes or serving food & drink from our bar and diner. Your professional and engaging customer service, along with your high energy and infectious enthusiasm will ensure our customers have an enjoyable, excellent value-for-money experience with every visit.

Within our fast-paced, dynamic world, Team Members are trained across all key areas of the centre, so you'll be able to provide support and add value at every stage of the customer journey.

Opening Hours And Shift Patterns

Our centres are typically open seven days a week, from 9am to midnight.

Within the leisure industry, our busiest times are evenings, weekends, and public school holidays, which tends to be when we require availability from Team Member applicants.

Here is an overview of the typical shift patterns we have in centre, from Monday to Sunday.

 Weekday AM shifts are typically 09.00 - 17.00
 Weekday PM shifts are typically 17.00 - 00.00
 Weekend AM shifts are typically 09.00 - 18.00
 Weekend PM shifts are typically 16.00 - 01.00

*Opening times and shift patterns will vary from centre to centre, your centre opening hours can be found online, and shift patterns will be confirmed at interview. Team Members under the age of 18 may be expected to work up until midnight, but no later.

You will be given a thorough induction and ongoing training and development to set you up for success, as well as ongoing development and career opportunities, including access to apprenticeship programmes and our in-house management training programmes, should you wish to take the next step in your career.

To be a successful Team Member, we'll want to see:

Great customer service, with the ability to communicate at all levels
High energy and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
A friendly, supportive and helpful team player
Flexibility with working hours and shift patterns
Basic literacy and numeracy skills

The Who...

Hollywood Bowl Group has a passion for bringing families and friends together for affordable fun and healthy competition.

Following our listing on the main stock market in 2016 we became Hollywood Bowl Group, seeking out the perfect locations for our bowling and golf centres nationwide. We formed our customer proposition, built on real feedback, and went from strength to strength with our in-centre game technology and online scoring systems.

Now with 69 centres across the UK, operating under the Hollywood Bowl and Puttstars brands, we're proud to be ambitious market leaders in experiential family entertainment.

We continue to expand our estate and look for profitable opportunities to grow, with an average of three new sites opening each year.

At Hollywood Bowl Group, we value diversity and inclusion, and we're committed to creating a working environment that promotes equal opportunities. Individual differences and the contributions of all employees are recognised and valued and we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company.

Your role

Desired Skills:

To have good manual dexterity.

Personal Qualities:

A keen interest and enthusiasm for automotive vehicles and the industry as a whole
To be honest and trustworthy with a willingness to learn
A positive attitude and work ethic, with high level of professionalism
To be able to work effectively as part of a team in a busy workshop environment, as well as having the capability to follow instructions and work individually

Desired Qualifications:

Applicants are required to have, or are predicted to obtain, GCSEs at grades A*-C/9-4 (or equivalent) in the following subjects:

English
Maths
One other subject

Future Prospects:

On successful completion of the apprenticeship, you will continue your development on the BMW Technical Programme.

Things To Consider:

Successful applicants must be prepared to travel to the BMW Group Academy in Berkshire to complete their apprenticeship training.

Training is completed in one-week blocks approximately once every two-three months.

All training costs are covered by the BMW Retailer (travel, accommodation and food).

About The Employer:

All Motor Vehicle Technician, Aftersales Customer Service (Parts & Service) and Motorcycle Technician Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer, and will attend the BMW Group Academy for their training. The BMW Group Academy is based at Wokefield Park near Reading in Berkshire.

All Bodyshop Technician (Paint & Panel) Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer or Bodyshop, and will attend our body training facility for their training. The body training facility is located in Milton Keynes.

Employer:

BMW Group Academy

Training Provider:

IMI Level 3 Motor Vehicle Service and Maintenance Technician
IMI Level 3 Award in Automotive Refrigeration Handling
IMI Level 2 Award in Electric / Hybrid Vehicle
IMI Accreditation Service Maintenance Technician

Apprenticeship Standard:

Motor vehicle service and maintenance technician (light vehicle)

Training Provider:

Applications for this apprenticeship are being processed by BMW Group Academy.

We are currently recruiting a Security Officer to support working on a high-profile embassy site in Edinburgh.

This exciting opportunity will allow you to work at a prestigious location, with a high standard of security needing to be met at all times. If you are in the security industry or are looking for a career change, then this would be perfect for you! We will offer on-site training, as well as career development too.

The rate of pay is £11.72 per hour.

This is a Casual position working on an ad-hoc basis to cover holidays, sickness and absence on site.

Your Time at Work

As a Security Officer at G4S, you are more than a Security Guard. You'll ensure the safety of our customers' staff, their buildings, and assets, whilst providing excellent customer service with a smile. We pride ourselves on delivering excellent customer service in a safe and secure environment.

Greeting staff and visitors in a friendly and professional manner
Ensuring everyone follows the security and safety protocols of the site
Gatehouse duties
Conducting searches when required
Patrolling of the premises - both inside and outside
Dealing with any security incidents on site and completing relevant incident report forms

With a keen eye and a brilliant way with people, you could look forward to an interesting role where no two days are the same with exciting career opportunities.

Our Perfect Worker

You will need to be aged 18 or over, a confident communicator who is a team player with the drive to provide a friendly and professional service at all times. Good IT knowledge is also key.

It would be a benefit to have some security experience and your SIA license, however, it's not essential, as we provide full SIA (Security Industry Authority) license training.

 Salary of £11.72 per hour

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Teaching Assistants, Norwich, Norfolk!

Are you passionate about education and looking for a rewarding role in the vibrant schools of Norwich, Norfolk? 4myschools is seeking dedicated and enthusiastic individuals to join our team as Daily Supply and Long Term Teaching Assistants. We have a variety of positions available from EYFS to KS4 in both primary and secondary schools.

Qualifications Not Necessary! Your Experience Matters!

We believe that a diverse range of experiences can make a positive impact in the classroom. You don't need formal teaching assistant qualifications to apply; instead, we welcome candidates with personal SEND experience, psychology backgrounds, healthcare experience, speech and language expertise, and more. Your unique skills and experiences could be exactly what a student needs to thrive.

Roles To Suit Your Availability

1:1 SEND Support:Provide tailored assistance to students with special educational needs, helping them reach their full potential.
Mainstream Classroom TAs:Support teachers in delivering engaging lessons, working with students from various backgrounds and abilities.
Part-Time and Full-Time Positions:We offer flexible working arrangements to fit your schedule, whether you're looking for part-time or full-time work.

What We Offer

Competitive Daily Rates
Ongoing Training and Development Opportunities
A Supportive Team and Friendly Work Environment
Opportunities to Make a Real Difference in Students' Lives

About 4myschools

4myschools is an education employment business. We have been delivering positive social impact from the beginning by reducing the cost of supply teachers to local schools and by paying teachers fairly. We believe that business has the power to change lives. By joining us you will be making a difference to the schools that we work with and the children that you teach. You will also make a difference on an international level to areas of poverty in the developing world. Every time a school uses 4myschools we give charitable donations for access to education in developing countries.

name_location: Reeson Education · Ealing, England, United Kingdom  1 week ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Have you recently graduated? 

Are you searching for a platform to kick start your career in education?

An Ofsted rated 'Good' Primary school in Ealing is currently recruiting for a Graduate Teaching Assistant to join them ASAP until the end of the academic year. The Primary school is situated near both tube and train stations and is easily accessible from most North-West and South West London boroughs. The Graduate Teaching Assistant will be expected to support in both KS1 and KS2.

This Primary school are looking for bright graduates who are enthusiastic and passionate about their input into a child's education. The Graduate who is appointed will be supporting the children in their numeracy and literacy within Key Stage 1 and 2. The Graduate Teaching Assistant's role will be to ensure each child is fulfilling the learning objectives for each lesson. Experience working with children in any capacity is highly desirable.

This is a fantastic platform for aspiring teachers to gain valuable experience in preparation for completing their teacher training the following year.

Your Responsibilities As a Graduate Teaching Assistant

Immerse yourself in diverse tasks suited to the age group and your unique skill set, from fostering creative activities to supporting the school's musical endeavours.
Partner closely with the class teacher, creating a safe and joyful classroom atmosphere while adeptly managing student behaviour.
Act as a pillar of support as children navigate the transition into young adulthood.
Keep a vigilant eye on student progress and occasionally liaise with parents, providing updates on their child's development.
Extend unwavering support to children with diverse learning needs, including those with autism, ADHD, or English as a second language.

This is an excellent opportunity for a graduate to expand their classroom experience prior to undertaking their teaching training and becoming a fully qualified classroom teacher.

If you are a Graduate or have experience working within schools and are interested in this Graduate Teaching Assistant position, please submit your updated CV ASAP.

Reeson Education

REESON Education is London's Premier Recruitment Agency. Established in 2006 by experienced teachers, education professionals and recruitment specialists, we have built our business and reputation on the cores values of honesty, integrity and excellence.

We care about education and the provision of education and have established an excellent reputation with schools and teachers alike.

At REESON Education we work closely with a large network of Nurseries, Primary Schools, Secondary Schools and Colleges across London. Our client base provides us with an abundance of available daily supply, long term and permanent opportunities across all age groups in all areas of London.

job_title: Trainee Network Engineer – No Experience Required
name_location: IT Career Switch · Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?

We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Network Engineer Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (21K-£35K) upon completion.

Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.

The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps.

Step 1 - Online Training

The first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco.

Step 2 - Practical Training

You will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today’s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies.

Step 3 - Official exams

You will then go on to sit the Cisco CCNA exam to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide.

Step 4 - IT Technician placement (£21-£35K)

You will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician, with a starting salary of anywhere between £21K-35K. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a Network engineer role.

Network Engineer Role

You will now be ready to move into your Network Engineer role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified Network Engineers.

At a one off cost of £999, or a deposit of £149 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £104, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.

Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.

Are you a kind, patient and caring individual looking to make a positive impact within your career?

Creative Support are looking for a Support Worker to join our friendly staff team in Grimsby, Lincolnshire. You will support adults with a learning disability with their daily lives.

Every day is different here at our service in Grimsby, Lincolnshire. The people we support enjoy going ice skating and dancing at local discos!

Support Worker Duties

Providing excellent care and support to individuals with learning disabilities, challenging behaviour and non-verbal communication requirements.
Encouraging service users to engage in a range of exciting social activities both within and outside their homes
Developing warm and trusting relationships with service users and their families enabling them to enjoy their time at the service to the fullest
Administrating and monitoring prescribed medication to service users.

No previous care experience is needed. We offer full and part time hours, weekend work and bank holidays. The service has great public transport links.

Benefits Of Working With Creative Support

A one-off bonus of £100 upon successful completion of the 4-month probationary period.
Competitive pay and a pension with company contribution and 28 days annual leave,
Company paid enhanced DBS for all staff
Free employee support programme
All our staff are supported 24/7 by our out-of-hours teams
Support to complete the nationally recognised Care Certificate and Social Care Diploma

Must hold practical Manual handling certificate

At least 6 months experience of working within a social care setting in the UK

UK Driving licence

Benefits

Free food while on shift

Variety of work in different social care and healthcare settings

Vetro Mobile Booking App for communicating shift availability

Support from specialist consultant

Free online training and subsidised practical training

About the job

Sunley Court, part of the Extra Care Charitable Trust, are recruiting now for a Care and Support Worker to work Nights (17 hours per week) on a permanent contract. 

This is an exciting time to be joining the friendly and supportive team at Sunley Court.  You will play a major part in providing the domiciliary care service

to our residents and promoting Independent Living to the over 55's.

This is domiciliary care with a difference. Everything is in one location meaning no travelling between jobs!

Benefits

£500 Golden Hello for All New Care and Support Workers (Criteria Applies)
33 Days Annual Leave (FTE) Pro Rata for Part Time
Buy And Sell Holiday
Free Life Insurance
Cycle2work Scheme
Attendance Reward
Ongoing Training and Development
Plus, Usual Benefits.

Are you currently a Care Assistant or Support Worker who is compassionate, patient, and personable and looking to progress your career with a forward-thinking Care Provider? If so, we would like to hear from you.

Role: Care and Support Worker Nights
Hours: 17 hours per week 
Salary: £11.22 per hour 
Location: Sunley Court, Pipers Hill Road, Kettering, NN15 7RJ

As a Care and Support Worker, you will be expected to carry out the following tasks:

Provide all aspects of domiciliary care to our residents including both physical, personal care and support with social activities,
Promoting and supporting the physical, emotional and well-being of our residents
Encourage independence and self-belief
Ensure records and documents are completed in line with our policy.

Please Note: This is a lone working position of waking nights. A Team Leader will be on site (sleeping) as back up and support. The shift pattern will be set with week one working a Friday and Saturday Night and week two working a Tuesday & Wednesday Night on a rolling basis. Night shifts will start at 10pm through to 7.30am with 1 hour's unpaid break. 

Person Specification

Hold a care certificate or willing to undertake a care qualification
Personable, an effective communicator and a team player
Passionate about delivering a quality care service

An extremely rewarding career awaits you if you like working in a friendly and supportive team, with variety and a fantastic working environment.

Sunley Court offers independent living to its residents. There are a range of facilities available to our residents such as Communal Lounge, Communal Parking, IT facilities, Greenhouse and Garden, Hairdressers and Beauty Salon, Library, Restaurant and Well-being Room.

Closing Date: 20th October 2023

Don't miss out! Click ‘apply' now to make an invaluable impact to the lives of our residents as one of our Care and Support Workers.ExtraCare is committed to making our recruitment practices as fair and inclusive as possible for all. This includes making reasonable adjustments to support candidates throughout the recruitment process.

Extracare does not participate in the current UK Visa Sponsorship scheme, and we are not able to facilitate sponsorship. Should we receive the maximum number of applications Extracare reserve the right to close this advertisement early. Be one of the first to apply!

About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
We're currently recruiting on behalf of a leading, dynamic financial services firm specializingin wealth management and investment analysis. They are renowned for their quality services, commitment to client satisfaction, and emphasis on employee growth and development.

Job Brief

The role is ideal for individuals who are passionate about finance and eager to gain hands-on experience with financial modeling, investment strategy creation, and market research.

Responsibilities

Supporting senior analysts and portfolio managers in conducting fundamental investment research.
Gathering, analyzing, and interpreting financial data utilizingstatistical software and models.
Developing financial models for evaluating investment opportunities with an eye for risk and return profiles.
Monitoring portfolio investments, tracking investment performance, and creating regular investment reports.
Staying up-to-date with market trends and investment strategies through consistent market research.
Assisting in the creation of client presentations and reports.
Participating in company conference calls, industry conferences, and investor meetings.
Complying strictly with all firm and industry regulations and guidelines.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in financial statements, ratios, and valuation techniques.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, and financial software.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
A strong interest in financial markets, investment strategies, and economic trends.

job_title: Trainee Project Management – No Experience Required
name_location: IT Career Switch · Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 2 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you looking to kick-start a new career?

We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Project Management Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee upon completion.

Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.

The traineeship is broken down into 3 easy steps.

Online Training

Complete a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised Project Management courses by including Prince2 & Agile. The training is delivered via video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study from home.

Practical Training

Now that you have learned all the theory it’s time to start applying that into practice so that you have the required experience to start within the industry. Our expert Project Manager tutor will provide you with 2 case scenarios for you to complete that will be based on real-world situations.

Official exams

At this final stage, we will prepare you to take your official Prince2 & Agile Foundation exams. The exams can be taken at one of the approved test centres across the UK or online from your own home.

PM Role

Through our range of partnerships throughout the UK with Project Management organisations, we are able to place you into an entry level role within your local area. You will be working as either a Project Coordinator or Project Administrator (£21K-£35K starting salary).

At a one off cost of £1499, or a deposit of £212 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £148, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in Project Management and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.

Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.

Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.

The traineeship is broken down into 3 easy steps.

Online Training

Complete a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised Project Management courses by including Prince2 & Agile. The training is delivered via video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study from home.

Practical Training

Now that you have learned all the theory it’s time to start applying that into practice so that you have the required experience to start within the industry. Our expert Project Manager tutor will provide you with 2 case scenarios for you to complete that will be based on real-world situations.

Official exams

At this final stage, we will prepare you to take your official Prince2 & Agile Foundation exams. The exams can be taken at one of the approved test centres across the UK or online from your own home.

PM Role

Through our range of partnerships throughout the UK with Project Management organisations, we are able to place you into an entry level role within your local area. You will be working as either a Project Coordinator or Project Administrator (£21K-£35K starting salary).

At a one off cost of £1499, or a deposit of £212 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £148, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in Project Management and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.

Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.

name_location: Reeson Education · Stonebridge, England, United Kingdom  13 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Unlock Your Potential as a Teaching Assistant in Brent!

Begin Your Inspiring Journey on October 2nd, 2023

Monday - Friday in Brent

Are you ready to pursue an exciting career path in teaching? Do you wish to gain valuable experience and confidence before taking the next step? Look no further - the role of a graduate teaching assistant awaits you!

Join a passionate team in Brent, where you will receive top-notch training in Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND) and safeguarding. As a graduate teaching assistant, you'll not only enhance your skills but also earn while you learn.

Don't miss this incredible opportunity to make a real impact and kickstart your teaching career. Apply today or contact Dan directly at (phone number removed) for more details.

Three Compelling Reasons to Dive into the World of Teaching Assistance:

 Empower Young Minds: Imagine providing one-on-one support to students, nurturing their academic, social, and emotional growth. Witnessing their achievements will be immensely gratifying. 
 Diverse and Engaging Work: Your role will be dynamic and engaging, involving collaboration with students of different ages, abilities, and backgrounds. You'll support them across various subjects and activities while interacting with teachers, support staff, and parents or caregivers. 
 Fulfillment and Purpose: Few professions offer the profound sense of fulfillment and purpose that comes from helping others succeed. 

Your Responsibilities:

 Engage in creative activities tailored to the age group and your unique skills. 
 Collaborate closely with class teachers to maintain a safe and positive classroom environment, effectively managing student behavior. 
 Guide students through the transition to young adulthood, offering support during this critical phase of their education. 
 Monitor student progress and occasionally communicate with parents to provide updates on their child's development. 
 Provide assistance to children with additional learning needs, including those with autism, ADHD, or English as a second language. 

If the prospect of working as a Teaching Assistant resonates with you, seize the moment and apply today. Alternatively, get in touch with Dan at (phone number removed) to learn more. Join us in making a positive impact on the educational journey of young minds in Brent. Your dedication and support can truly make a difference.

Reeson Education:

REESON Education is London's Premier Recruitment Agency. Established in 2006 by experienced teachers, education professionals and recruitment specialists, we have built our business and reputation on the cores values of honesty, integrity and excellence.

We care about education and the provision of education and have established an excellent reputation with schools and teachers alike.

At REESON Education we work closely with a large network of Nurseries, Primary Schools, Secondary Schools and Colleges across London. Our client base provides us with an abundance of available daily supply, long term and permanent opportunities across all age groups in all areas of London.

Please note that all daily/hourly rates quoted are inclusive of holiday pay at 12.07

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
🌟 Embark on a Rewarding Journey as a Teaching Assistant - Guiding an ASD Student in Year 2 🌟

An exciting opportunity beckons for a dedicated and empathetic Teaching Assistant to provide essential support to a Year 2 pupil with ASD. This role is situated within a vibrant primary school located in Camden.

🏫 About The Position

Title: Teaching Assistant
Location: Camden, London
Year Group: Year 2
Support: Tailored assistance for a student with ASD who thrives with additional support
Objective: Guiding the student's learning journey and ensuring a positive educational experience

🌈 Why Choose This School for a Teaching Assistant Career?

Impactful Role: As a Teaching Assistant, you'll play a pivotal role in a student's educational progress.
Supportive Atmosphere: Collaborate with experienced educators and SEN specialists in a nurturing environment - perfect for a Teaching Assistant.
Professional Growth: Teaching Assistants have access to comprehensive training and development opportunities.
Inspirational: Witness the student's progress and growth facilitated by your dedicated guidance as a Teaching Assistant.

👩‍🏫 Responsibilities As a Teaching Assistant

Teaching Assistants will provide dedicated tailored support for the Year 2 student with ASD.
Foster an inclusive and supportive learning environment conducive to the student's growth.
Employ effective strategies customised to the student's unique needs, maximising their learning potential.
Collaborate closely with the class teacher and SENCO to craft personalised support plans.

📚 Requirements For The Teaching Assistant Role

Previous experience as a Teaching Assistant, especially in assisting students with additional support needs.
Display empathy and a deep understanding of the diverse needs of students.
Possess exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, essential attributes for a Teaching Assistant.
Demonstrate patience, empathy, and a heartfelt passion for fostering student success.

For those seeking a gratifying role as a Teaching Assistant, this opportunity is ideal. Teaching Assistants play a pivotal role in shaping a brighter future for young students. Seize the chance to become a valued Teaching Assistant within the Camden school community!

🏫 Where Teaching Assistants Embrace Each Day as an Opportunity to Inspire and Empower 🌟

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
The Job

Working as part of a team providing excellent customer service wherever there is interaction with one of our customers
Maintaining an accurate stock record and carry out regular scheduled stock counts
Placing stock and special orders
The contracted hours for this role are 37 or more

What's in it for you?

Here at Selco, we value our colleagues, and you will be entitled to a whole host of benefits when working with us. We offer a wide range of lifestyle perks, including;

Free health cash plan, making it easy for you and your family to get the healthcare you need and claim back the costs.
Profit Based bonus scheme, up to £175 per month.
Discounts and offers at thousands of retailers, cinemas, restaurants, amusement parks and gyms.
Generous staff discount on all products sold in store.
Competitive company pension scheme.
Cycle to work scheme.
Holiday Buying.
Free life assurance.
Share save scheme.

At Selco, the opportunities for professional growth and development are limitless. We actively support and encourage internal advancements through a fully developed and supported career path, with plenty of training opportunities along the way to help you develop the career path you want.

About Us

Fancy developing your career with the UK's fastest growing builders' merchant? We're on the lookout for enthusiastic and ambitious individuals with a 'can do' attitude to help us serve the nation's tradespeople.

We won't pretend it's not hard work and at times a challenging environment however you'll be working with some great people and in return we offer a first-class rewards package.

We're growing year-on-year with no signs of slowing down. With new branches opening their doors nationwide, this is your chance to be a part of our exciting journey and build your career with Selco.

We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunities employer and are committed to creating a work environment that is diverse, inclusive and welcoming to all. Our aim is for Selco colleagues to be a true representation of all sections of society. We are committed to the Health and Safety of our Colleagues being our top priority.

name_location: Smile Education · Redditch, England, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
We know that working in education can be tough. However, it is a career that is full of challenge, reward, and fulfilment. Every day, through your contribution, you are making a real difference to the lives of children and young people with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND) and this makes it all worthwhile.

If you are interested in applying for this job, please make sure you meet the following requirements as listed below.

If you have a heart for helping children and young people achieve their fullest potential, perhaps consider a starting your career as a Learning Support Worker (SEND) and embark on a rewarding journey that transforms lives!

Why Choose a Career as a Learning Support Worker (SEND)?

Meaningful Impact: As a Learning Support Worker, you will play a pivotal role in the educational journey of children and young people with SEND. You will empower them to overcome challenges and reach their academic and personal goals.

Diverse and Inclusive Environment: Work in a diverse and inclusive setting that fosters creativity, empathy, and understanding. Be a part of a community that celebrates differences and promotes inclusivity.

Professional Growth: You will receive ongoing training and development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge. You'll receive the support you need to excel in your role and achieve your career goals.

Personal Fulfilment: Experience the joy of helping others succeed. Witness the progress and milestones of your students, and share in their triumphs, both big and small.

Responsibilities

Provide one-on-one or small group support to students with SEND, helping them access the curriculum and achieve their learning objectives.

Foster a positive and nurturing learning environment that encourages confidence and independence.

Collaborate with teachers, therapists, and parents to develop and implement individualised learning plans.

Maintain accurate records of student progress and behaviour.

Promote communication and social skills development.

Requirements

Qualifications or experience in education or special education are desirable but not essential.

Empathy, patience, and a genuine desire to help others succeed.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to the needs of each student.

Join us in making a difference in the lives of children and young people with SEND. Together, we can create a brighter future filled with endless possibilities!

To apply, please send your CV today!

name_location: Reeson Education · Hammersmith, England, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Job Title: Teaching Assistant

Location: Hammersmith, London

Start Date: ASAP

Pay: £80 - £100 per day 

A thriving mainstream primary school located in the vibrant borough of Hammersmith, are currently seeking a Full-Time Teaching Assistant to join the team. This primary school is committed to providing a nurturing and inclusive learning environment where every child can thrive. As a Full-Time Teaching Assistant, you will play a crucial role in supporting teachers and students in their daily activities. You will work closely with classroom teachers and other Teaching Assistants to create a positive and engaging learning atmosphere, ensuring that all students have the opportunity to reach their full potential.

Responsibilities Of The Teaching Assistant: 

Assisting with classroom management and behaviour support.
Providing one-on-one or small group support to students as directed by the teacher.
Supporting students with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND).
Helping with the supervision of students during break times and outings.
Creating a safe and inclusive learning environment for all students.

Qualifications:

The successful Teaching Assistant should possess the following qualifications and qualities:

Previous experience working with children, ideally in an educational setting.
A passion for education and a commitment to fostering student growth.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Patience, adaptability, and a positive attitude.
A willingness to learn and take direction from experienced educators.
A Level 2 or 3 Teaching Assistant qualification or equivalent is desirable but not essential.

What We Offer:

A supportive and collaborative working environment.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Competitive Teaching Assistant salary and benefits package.
Onsite Teaching Assistant training and mentorship.
The chance to make a meaningful difference in the lives of young learners.

How To Apply:

If you are an enthusiastic and dedicated Teaching Assistant, ready to embark on a rewarding career in education, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your CV below!

name_location: Dovehaven Care Homes · Liverpool, England, United Kingdom  1 day ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Dovehaven Care Homes are recruiting for aCare Assistantto join our team atChurch View Nursing Home, Old swan, Liverpool.Working 8pm- 8am with every other weekend involved, Full timeContract available.

To see the Home follow the Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E-Bky1Lo3_E

Church View is a Nursing and residential care home catering for up to 35 residents. The home specialises in dementia care, and our aim is to ensure all our residents feel as comfortable as possible. Our homes promote independence, dignity and respect through positive risk taking and empowerment.

About The Role

As Care Assistant, you will assist other staff in the running of the Home and maintain high standards of care and service towards service users, relatives, visitors and other members of staff. You will be providing a range of personal and practical care to our residents.

Duties And Responsibilities

Demonstrate compassion and empathy in your approach to caring for older people, either through previous roles in social care or in other roles.
Self-motivated, resilient and well-organised.
Dependable, able to work well under pressure and flexible to meet the needs of the residents and the Home.

Skills And Experience

Caring and sensitive to the needs of others
Committed to providing service excellence
Able to communicate effectively
Able to provide emotional and social support
Committed to providing a high standard of care, promoting dignity and respect
NVQ Level 2 health and social care is desirable

In Return We Offer

Fortnightly Pay
28 days annual leave (pro rata)
Free parking
Cost of DBS Check
Comprehensive induction
On-going training and development with the Dovehaven Training Academy
Uniform provided

Required

As part of our recruitment process you will be required to complete an Enhanced DBS check. Their code of conduct can be found on the following link that you can copy and post to your web browser if you wish to read:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/dbs-code-of-practice

If you feel you have the right values for our family run Company, you will be supported by a programme of induction, training and development throughout your career with us.

name_location: Euro Communications Distribution Ltd · Wolverhampton, England, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 8 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Salary - £34k to £60k

Wolverhampton, West Midlands

Full Time, Permanent Role. Hours Flexible to suit 37.5 to 42.5 hours per week.

All Salaries quoted are for UK residents; we do accept candidates from outside the UK and sponsor them on a Tier 2 visa; however, the salary would be different.

Joining a thriving and in-demand eco-friendly company who have been operating for over 23 years and growing impressively ever since the Front End Web Developer has an exciting opportunity to join a company where management is as passionate about developing as the developers.

Recognising that the key to success is the quality of staff, an ongoing investment in training enables staff in all areas of the team to respond to the changing environment within which we operate.

Are you a Front End developer with a passion for development? Do you want to work in house for a company where YOUR SAY MATTERS?

The Role

We require a talented front end developer with in-depth knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, VueJS and NuxtJS.

The position is key to our continued growth and will support in the continuous development of bespoke inhouse software and external web-based applications.

The role is office based a few times per months it is an extremely collaborative organisation with a flat structure. One of our USP's is you will have a very powerful voice in all decisions. You will be a highly valued member and not just another developer.

We will allow you to work with leadership and autonomy where you will influence the company’s future.

You will need to have worked in a recent role with at least 3 years' experience.

Requirements

We pride ourselves on our 'can-do' attitude and are looking for exactly that type of attitude to move them forward.

 At least 3 years experience in a commercial environment
 An in-depth knowledge HTML, CSS, JavaScript, VueJS and NuxtJS with demonstrable experience
 A demonstrable understanding of the importance of writing secure code
 Experience in GIT
 Educated to A-level or equivalent recognised developer qualifications
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 Experience with TDD (Test Driven Development)
 Experience with Docker
 Experience with TailwindCSS (We use TailwindCSS as our CSS framework)
 Experience with CSS Preprocessor (Good to have)
 Ability to come up with ideas that help improve the user experience and increase website conversions and self-serve functionality
 Realising designs as responsive, functional web pages
 Experience of working With APIs
 An understanding of SEO and website analytical tools

We value and have a very diverse workforce and welcome applications from all sections of the community, regardless of any protected characteristics.

We also offer the opportunity to lead and build a team if this is something that appeals to you.

Company Perks

 Permanent position
 Apple equipment supplied
 Expenses covered for tech conferences
 Flexible working hours
 UK sponsorship available for non-residents after 8 months probationary period
 Hybrid working available - 2 days a week in the office
 Staff discounts
 Pension scheme
 Days out and other social events
 Free onsite parking
 Equal opportunities employer fully committed to diversity, equality and inclusion
 Birthdays off and paid for without having to use any holiday entitlement.
 28 days holiday, including bank holidays
 1 extra day holiday rewarded for every year of service

job_title: Trainee Network Engineer – No Experience Required
name_location: IT Career Switch · Wolverhampton, England, United Kingdom  3 weeks ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?

We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Network Engineer Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (21K-£35K) upon completion.

Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.

The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps.

Step 1 - Online Training

The first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco.

Step 2 - Practical Training

You will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today’s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies.

Step 3 - Official exams

You will then go on to sit the Cisco CCNA exam to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide.

Step 4 - IT Technician placement (£21-£35K)

You will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician, with a starting salary of anywhere between £21K-35K. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a Network engineer role.

Network Engineer Role

You will now be ready to move into your Network Engineer role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified Network Engineers.

At a one off cost of £999, or a deposit of £149 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £104, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.

Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.

name_location: Asda Logistics Services · Watford, England, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
If the shifts for this role cover hours between midnight and 5am, you will need to be at least 18 years of age.

Please note in addition to the advertised hourly rate, a further £2.54 nightshift premium is paid for every hour worked between midnight and 5am (where applicable).

 Are you looking for a flexible role in a fast-paced environment? Do you love working as part of a team to deliver outstanding service to customers? 

 What's in it for you? 

Alongside a competitive salary, we offer a great range of other benefits too. You'll receive a discount card for yourself and a second card for your nominated user, giving you 10% off your shopping and you'll alsoreceive a company pension. On the ‘Our Asda' benefits site, you will have access to a wide range of discounts across various activities and services, anything from airport parking to theme parks and pet insurance to car tyres – whatever you're into there's something to suit everyone!

About The Role

Our operation runs 24 hours per day, 7 days per week, with that brings a wide variety of shift patterns – if you're looking for flexible working to fit around your lifestyle, then look no further! We know the demand for online shopping is increasing so some of our shifts can start as early as 2am. We'll work with you on your shifts, but weekend working is a requirement of the role and we may need to be flexible with your work pattern.

Our customers expect fresh, great quality products that are always available. More and more of our customers are choosing to shop online and have their groceries delivered straight to their door. As one of our Online Service Colleagues, you're in the shoes of our customers who've put their trust in you to pick their shopping. You'll be using the latest technology to navigate around the shop floor to pick their shop and to pack it carefully.

Wherever you are we put our customers first. With excellent service and ‘extra special' products we work as a team to maximise sales and deliver a great online shopping experience.

About You

You'll be naturally friendly and want to get stuck in, working with your team to deliver great results. You'll have an enthusiastic approach and be passionate about delivering the best online shopping experience by ensuring the smooth and safe running of the operation. You'll be able to lift items of all shapes and sizes. You'll be able to meet deadlines and demonstrate attention to detail when picking products.

Apply today by completing an online application…

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
My client is currently looking to take on a Power Platform Developer / Power Apps Developer to work within their Digital Solution team, initially on a 12-month Fixed-term contract, but with good possibility of going permanent thereafter.

The ideal candidate will have experience developing solutions within a Microsoft environment developing Power Platform solutions / Power Apps within a low code/ no code environment. You'll also have had some experience building and automating CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Docker, or Kubernetes.- paying £30,000-£52,500pa DOE + enhanced pension scheme & other great benefits.

An amazing investor in people, this public sector organisation will allow you to navigate your own future by providing unparalleled exposure to the latest technology; designed to utilise your current skillset and develop further skills. Actively encouraging an appetite for learning, this organisation will commit to providing and funding Microsoft training, certification, and conferences where appropriate.

PLEASE NOTE: The role will be mainly home based with a requirement to be able to travel to Bristol as needed up to once a week but more likely far less than this. All work is conducted within the UK, and you must have full right to work, as my client cannot offer sponsorship.

Essential Skillset/ Experience

 Experience developing solutions within a Microsoft environment: Power Apps / Power Platform solutions in a low code/ no code environment
 Understanding of Development life cycle
 Building / Managing CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Docker or Kubernetes
 Some awareness or exposure to broader Azure Environment: Azure Logic Apps/ Azure Functions or Power Automate

Desirable Skillset/ Experience

 Power BI
 Dynamics 365 CRM/ SharePoint
 Infrastructure as code, eg Terraform

If you meet the requirements of this role and would like to find out more about this opportunity, please apply to my role with an updated CV to be considered as my client is moving very quickly with this role.

name_location: Hollywood Bowl Group Plc · Bury, England, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 1 applicant
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
About The Role

Are you looking for a fun and fast paced environment to work in, with great benefits?

Could you help us create lasting memories for our customers by providing outstanding customer service?

If so, then look no further!

The Why...

Join Hollywood Bowl Group as a Team Member, in return you'll get:

The opportunity to earn an extra 50p per hour, paid to you every month
Access to apprenticeship programmes and our in-house management training programmes
Optional pension plan
Additional days holiday with length of service up to five days
Ongoing training and development, with the opportunity to fast track your career
Free game vouchers every month
30% discount off food and drink for you and up to five friends
50% off food when you are working
Access to our Employee Assistant Programme (EAP) for you and your family, plus access to our dedicated Mental Health First Aiders
Financial long service awards
A £15 donation to Barnardo's when you complete your induction
Enhanced maternity, paternity, adoption, and shared parental leave benefits
Opportunity to join our healthcare cash plan

The What...

As a Team Member for Hollywood Bowl Group, you will be at the very centre of the customer's journey!

No two shifts are the same, you may be welcoming customers at reception, hosting parties on the lanes or serving food & drink from our bar and diner. Your professional and engaging customer service, along with your high energy and infectious enthusiasm will ensure our customers have an enjoyable, excellent value-for-money experience with every visit.

Within our fast-paced, dynamic world, Team Members are trained across all key areas of the centre, so you'll be able to provide support and add value at every stage of the customer journey.

Opening Hours And Shift Patterns

Our centres are typically open seven days a week, from 9am to midnight.

Within the leisure industry, our busiest times are evenings, weekends, and public school holidays, which tends to be when we require availability from Team Member applicants.

Here is an overview of the typical shift patterns we have in centre, from Monday to Sunday.

 Weekday AM shifts are typically 09.00 - 17.00
 Weekday PM shifts are typically 17.00 - 00.00
 Weekend AM shifts are typically 09.00 - 18.00
 Weekend PM shifts are typically 16.00 - 01.00

*Opening times and shift patterns will vary from centre to centre, your centre opening hours can be found online, and shift patterns will be confirmed at interview. Team Members under the age of 18 may be expected to work up until midnight, but no later.

You will be given a thorough induction and ongoing training and development to set you up for success, as well as ongoing development and career opportunities, including access to apprenticeship programmes and our in-house management training programmes, should you wish to take the next step in your career.

To be a successful Team Member, we'll want to see:

Great customer service, with the ability to communicate at all levels
High energy and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
A friendly, supportive and helpful team player
Flexibility with working hours and shift patterns
Basic literacy and numeracy skills

The Who...

Hollywood Bowl Group has a passion for bringing families and friends together for affordable fun and healthy competition.

Following our listing on the main stock market in 2016 we became Hollywood Bowl Group, seeking out the perfect locations for our bowling and golf centres nationwide. We formed our customer proposition, built on real feedback, and went from strength to strength with our in-centre game technology and online scoring systems.

Now with 70 centres across the UK, operating under the Hollywood Bowl and Puttstars brands, we're proud to be ambitious market leaders in experiential family entertainment.

We continue to expand our estate and look for profitable opportunities to grow, with an average of three new sites opening each year.

At Hollywood Bowl Group, we value diversity and inclusion, and we're committed to creating a working environment that promotes equal opportunities. Individual differences and the contributions of all employees are recognised and valued and we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company.

name_location: ECEM Trading · Bradford, England, United Kingdom  2 days ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
***NEW VACANCY***

IMMEDIATE JOB STARTS AVAILABLE*** No experience required

Path2 are working on behalf of a Bradford based Care Home. Our client provides exceptional care and support to their residents, ensuring their comfort, safety, and well-being is always our top priority. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals who have been out of work and are looking to kick-start their career. You don't need any prior experience - just a caring nature and the desire to make a difference. As a Domestic Staff member, you will play a vital role in creating a warm and homely atmosphere that our residents can truly call home.

Successful applicants will be working in the care home in the BD3 are of Bradford. Duties are and include:

Maintain cleanliness and hygiene standards throughout the care home, ensuring a safe and comfortable living environment for our residents.

Carry out domestic duties such as cleaning, laundry, and tidying in accordance with established guidelines and schedules.

Participate in team meetings, training sessions, and continuous professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge.

We offer various shifts including weekend shifts. Long term permanent positions available with progression opportunities for the right people. Applicants must be flexible for a start ASAP.

Immediate start available

Shifts: Full time and part time, various shifts available to fit around your life.

Benefits

A fulfilling and meaningful career within a supportive and inclusive environment.

Comprehensive training and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career in the care sector.

Competitive package and employee benefits.

The chance to work alongside a dedicated team of professionals who share your passion for providing exceptional care.

Pay Rate:£10.90 - £14.00 per hour (overtime rates & shifts available)

Care Assistantmust

Be over 19 years old

Have lived in the UK for at least 3 years

Not currently be in full time education

Be willing to commit to an upfront training programme over 3 days to gain the skills for the job

This is a fantastic opportunity for a committed candidate looking to start work as soon as possible. Progression opportunities with this client are excellent with candidates able to build a solid career in care.

name_location: GNG Communications · Leeds, England, United Kingdom  1 week ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Recruitment - Fast Growing Start-Up - Fast Track Progression Routes

Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Recruitment - OTE Y1 £40,000 / OTE Y2 £55,000 / OTE Y3 £75,000 +.

This fast growing and ambitious firm are on an exciting period of growth and are looking for driven individuals to join the business. You will be part of the first core 25 first employees which will be instrumental in building an international world renown firm. The founders of the business were previously the top performers at the worlds No 1. Recruitment firm and have over 2 decades of market leading training development and success.You will be learning from the best!

Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Recruitment - State of the Art Technology

The business focus on the fastest growing market in the world, Technology. They have already secured some household Technology firms and are helping them build exceptional teams. As they believe in technology, they invest heavily into the industries best technology for their employees. This allows you to have all the cutting-edge help that you need to streamline your career.

Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Recruitment - The Benefits

£23,000 Basic Salary + Uncapped Market Leading Commission
International relocation opportunities
Employee well-being scheme
Personal & professional development budget
Company socials
Award winning training academy
All expensed paid trips to New York, Las Vegas, Ibiza for top performers

Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Recruitment - The Role

Youll join as a Trainee Consultant, where you will be given step by step training on how to run and manage your own candidate and client portfolio. You will begin as a Resourcer where you will be responsible for managing the candidate process, before moving onto the client side of recruitment, and establishing yourself as a full 360 recruiter.

Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Recruitment -The Requirements

Good academics - 2:2 or above from University OR commercial exp.
Strong work ethic shown by work experience, internships and extra-curricular activity
Competitive nature - sporting background is ideal but not necessary
Ambitious and driven
Money motivated and the desire to be the best
Strong communication skills and the ability to converse with people at all levels

name_location: Thames Valley Police · Reading, England, United Kingdom  3 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Department 1

Force Intelligence Hub

Location 1

Oxford, Reading

Rank/Grade 1

TVP Broad Band 3G

Salary 1

Band 3G, circa £32,287 per annum pro-rata plus 7% shift allowance plus benefits

Part/Full Time 1

Full Time - All roles are available for flexible working including job sharing and part-time unless there are legitimate operational / business reasons why this cannot be accommodated

Type of Contract 1

Permanent

Job Advert 1

1 x position at Reading, 1 x position at Oxford

In line with the Force Delivery Plan you will identify Threat Risk and harm impacting or likely to impact on the welfare and quality of life to the residents and visitors to the Thames Valley Police area. You will collect, analyse, evaluate, develop and disseminate intelligence relating to instances of disorder, criminals and non crime incidents.

Principle Responsibilities:


Interrogate, retrieve and input data to and from computer systems in compliance with force policy and relevant legislation (e.g. Data Protection Act). Use available intelligence systems and open source opportunities to develop information and intelligence relating to problems and subjects. Prepare intelligence packages in respect of the same.
Ensure that relevant intelligence is communicated at daily and operational briefings based on Force and LPA priorities to ensure threats, risk and harm are identified. Produce, maintain and update a daily intelligence briefing for the LPAs and ensure effective dissemination both internally and externally as required.
Research, collate and evaluate information and intelligence to identify crime patterns, trends and hotspots, in order that police resources can be tasked appropriately.
Evaluate and distribute intelligence in accordance with requirements of the Management of Police Information guidance and any Memoranda of Understanding and Information Sharing Agreements, and the dissemination of that data.
Liaise with others involved in the intelligence process to promote an effective interchange of intelligence. Participate in crime series meetings, including cross-border and briefings to support and assist police activity.
Produce, maintain and update a daily intelligence briefing for the LPAs and ensure effective dissemination both internally and externally as required.
Research and procure observation posts to support operational activity at the behest of Intelligence Supervisors in support of level 2 Force Tasking Authorities.
Provide full support and guidance to officers and staff in relation to intelligence. Provide guidance on the submission of intelligence products and support to LPA’s in respect of CID51 applications for Level 2 support through the TT&CG process.
Prepare intelligence products (subject records) to support police activity towards organised crime groups. Identify serious offences requiring higher level research techniques.
To research and complete RIPA and telecoms applications


required using the Charter database. Responsible for the gathering of intelligence and information in support of the FRAM and FIA process.


Liaise with LPAs, Force CID, other intelligence resources, and other departments as required.


As part of the Thames Valley Police family you will enjoy a fantastic range of benefits including 24 days annual leave per annum, pro-rata for part time (plus Bank Holidays), flexible working conditions, a wide range of lifestyle discounts, career development opportunities and have the option to join a local government pension scheme. To view a full list of our benefits, please click the below link.

Along with all other posts in Force Crime, Intelligence and Specialist Operations Departments, this role will require an enhanced level of vetting. If you have any queries please contact the Recruitment Team at RecruitmentPoliceStaff@thamesvalley.police.uk quoting reference 20803 for Reading and 20802 for Oxford

For more information on this role please contact Karl Ralph on Karl.Ralph@thamesvalley.police.uk

We will endeavour to respond to your query as quickly as possible.

If you are an ‘at risk’ member of staff, please apply directly to the At Risk Recruitment Mailbox with your REI form and do not complete the online application.

 Please use Google Chrome when completing your application, wherever possible, as this will enhance performance. 

The closing date for enquiries and receipt of completed applications is Sunday 22nd October 2023.

Find out more about our roles here .

(for on site working)

At Thames Valley Police (TVP) we work together to protect our communities. Whether as an officer, staff member or volunteer, you will make a difference and play an important role in helping achieve our mission. As you take on a role with pride and confidence, you will be supported, developed and valued, ensuring you can be at your best in the service of our communities. Learn more About Us .

 Working Smart  . You will be joining an organisation that strives to improve every day. In the post-pandemic era this means changing the way we work and deliver our services, which brings a number of benefits including a more flexible and capable workforce.

Supporting You  . Your wellbeing and safety is at the heart of all we do. Whilst you are doing the work that matters, we’ll be supporting you via a wide range of Wellbeing services, partnerships and initiatives. We have a number of active staff support networks and buddy schemes which you will have access to and can be involved with. We also offer a comprehensive range of benefits and discount schemes, some provided directly by the organisation and others via partnerships including Blue Light card. Learn more about how we will be Supporting You .

Developing You. We promote a culture where your continuous professional development and learning is actively encouraged and where people have the opportunity, and responsibility, to achieve their full potential.

 Valuing Difference  . We are committed to building a workforce that better reflects the communities we serve and an inclusive culture that not only values, but finds strength in difference. Learn more about how we are Valuing Difference .

 Vetting.  All posts require a level of Police Vetting as per the National Vetting Code of Practice. The residency requirement is necessary to enable all applicants to be checked in an equitable manner. Thames Valley Police will allow applicants to apply who do not necessarily reach the criteria as long as they have proven UK residency and supporting evidence where necessary. Applications will be considered on a case by case basis.

About the job

What we offer

Comfort Call is part of City & County Healthcare Group, the largest home care provider in the UK. Join us as a care assistant and you’ll be part of a friendly, local team that will support and look after you and you’ll also have access to all the resources, career pathways, benefits, investments, opportunities and security that being part of City & County Healthcare Group brings. It’s the best of both worlds.

What you’ll do

Our care assistants are the extraordinary people who do the everyday things that mean so much to our clients. Supporting vulnerable people to live safer and supported lives in their own homes, you’ll follow individual care plans and help with practical tasks like shopping, mealtimes and housework. You’ll also assist with personal care and help clients to bathe, dress, manage incontinence, use the toilet and support with their medication. You’ll be supported by a close-knit care team and accessible managers. While our mobile care app will reduce paperwork and help you to deliver high quality care. Every day will be different. And you’ll never know what challenges you’re about to face next. One thing you can be sure of though, is that you’ll be making your clients’ days brighter.

What you’ll get

We offer thorough training from day one and continuous development through coaching conversations, e-learning modules and access to further qualifications and courses. We’ll give you the support and opportunity to develop your career, either within your branch or the wider City & County Healthcare Group. We’ll also empower you to feel proud of the important and meaningful work that you do.

What you’ll need

You don’t need any experience to apply for this role, just plenty of care, compassion and resilience.

Why choose us?

We see extraordinary achievements happen every day thanks to the talent and commitment of our people. We want to transform the care industry by working smarter, using innovative tech and driving forward positive change. As the largest care company in the UK, we have the size and success to offer you a world of career opportunity, choice and security. Join us on our journey and continue yours.

City and County Healthcare Group is an equal opportunities employer.

Are you a compassionate and dedicated Teaching Assistant seeking an exciting opportunity to support students with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in a dynamic SEN school? Look no further! The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across space, air, land, sea and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $18 billion in annual revenue and 50,000 employees, with customers in more than 100 countries.

Description

Job Title - Software Engineer 

Job Location - Tewkesbury OR Fleet, UK

Flexible, condensed or reduced working hours available, i.e. 4-day condensed working week, 9-day fortnights,12pm finish every Friday, etc.

Job ID - SAS20232509-106437

About This Opportunity And L3Harris UK

L3Harris in Tewkesbury and Fleet are part of our ICI division, we work closely with UK Government and Security Agencies primarily in the areas of Crypto/Cyber Security and Electronic Warfare including Counter IED capability.

You will be involved in the full engineering lifecycle, from conception and architecture, through to low level design and implementation of embedded software in our products. You will be an integral part of a development team and there will be opportunities to work on the latest evolution of our award-winning flagship CATAPAN product family, or on our Corvus development which is changing the face of Electronic Countermeasures in the Defence sector.

C++
Python
Rust

What You'll Bring

Solid experience of object orientated design and implementation principles (OOD, OOP)
Previous Software Engineering experience in one or more language (C++, Python, Rust, Java, etc.) with up-to-date skills and a keen interest in industry best practice
Track record of producing reliable, robust, intuitive, maintainable software

A Few Of Our Employee Benefits Are

15% sign on bonus
£3,000 to £6,000 DV Bonus - please note this level of clearance isn't essential for this role. This bonus is subject to individual clearance and project requirements - discussed upon application.
Hybrid working where possible

25 days holiday per year (plus bank holidays), increasing with long service and with the opportunity to buy/sell up to 5 days
Private medical insurance with optional family cover
Pension scheme of up to 7% employer contribution
Life Assurance 4x salary (flexible up to 10x)
Group income protection
Flexible opt-in extras such as a health care cash plan, dental insurance, gym membership, critical illness cover and cycle to work scheme
Employee assistance program providing mental health and wellbeing support
Professional registration with the IET (Engineers only)

Important to know

Many of our roles require the ability to obtain a security clearance relevant to the country of the position. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information and may be subject to government security checks.

L3Harris Technologies is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination and offers equal opportunities for all. Role Purpose

Building relationships across our clients with regular and frequent client contact including commercial presentations, performance reviews and analysis is central to the success of this position.

The role will play a central part in the visualisation of data to ensure that the client receives analysis and measurement in an easy to use and visually engaging format.

Key Tasks And Responsibilities

Reporting, Insight & Evaluation

Apply below after reading through all the details and supporting information regarding this job opportunity.

To build relationships across our Clients with regular and frequent contact including attendance at commercial presentations, performance reviews and analysis
To build relationships with the Account team and the Insight team

Lead the identification of commercial opportunity in order to direct and challenge client strategy

Operational analysis

Impact analysis

To supply analysis on Price impact
To measure and analyse the impact of POS (Point of Sale) location
To deliver distribution compliance and opportunity analysis
To provide impactful analysis on Planogram compliance

Lead the analysis on supply chain operational efficiencies

Presentation & Reporting

Responsible for producing and presenting the findings of analysis to key contacts within Client’s group
To build and deliver regular data reports to the Client on a frequent basis, ensuring to deliver cutting insight and visual impact
To take ownership for ensuring all system generated reports are delivered accurately and to an agreed schedule

Field Optimisation

To consistently utilise territory optimisation and journey planning software

 Self-motivated, confident, and determined
 Administration and organisational skills

Desirable

 Power BI

Good communication (written and verbal communication skills including ability to present)

Good interpersonal skills, including rapport building and influencing

Analysis and judgement skills / Decision making

Target driven with good time and task management skills and ability to meet deadlines

Customer focus

Self-motivated, confident and determined

Advanced level Excel

Intermediate/Advanced PowerPoint skills

Good administration and organisational skills

Previous Experience With Power BI Desirable But Not Essential

Previous retail and/or FMCG experience desirable

Our culture is at the core of everything we do. Our relationships and behaviours are interwoven with our Guiding Principles which represent who we are, what we stand for and how we conduct ourselves.

name_location: IT Career Switch · Luton, England, United Kingdom  12 hours ago  · 0 applicants
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Are you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?

We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Cyber Security Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (21K-£35K) upon completion.

Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.

The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps.

Step 1 - Online Training

The first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco.

Step 2 - Practical Training

You will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today’s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies.

Step 3 - Official exams

You will then go on to sit the CompTIA A+ exams to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide.

Step 4 - IT Technician placement (£21-£35K)

You will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician, with a starting salary of anywhere between £21K-35K. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a Cyber Security role.

Cyber Security Role

You will now be ready to move into your Cyber Security role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified Cyber Security professionals.

At a one off cost of £999, or a deposit of £149 followed by 10 interest free monthly instalments of £104, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.

Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.
